Reviews.Title: “Great service and lobby vibe”
Reviews.Author: WinsorTraveler
Reviews.Content: St. Regis service is world-class. What makes the biggest difference is the attitude of the staff- cheerful, helpful, will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable- from the bellman to the butlers!

Reviews.Title: “Wait... how many stars does this place have?!?”
Reviews.Author: garrettsr
Reviews.Content: I came here with 2 friends (one a platinum member) for a girls trip to shop and see the sites of San Francisco. The hotel is very modern and cool. We were told we would receive an upgrade to our room and of course we were very excited. We get to the room and it is a normal standard room...... we then worry about what sort of room we would have been in to begin with. After a day of shopping we return to our room to find that it was not cleaned. We look at the room controller to see that we had accidentally left the do not disturb button on. Our bad. So one of the girls calls to have some fresh towels sent up and ask to just have our beds made. No one comes. The next day we ask the concierge to book us to see Alcatraz. She gives us the number so we could do it. Wait a second...... No we need you to do it..... So she does. We taxi down to that area early to go ahead to will call to get our tickets so we could have a nice lunch before Alcatraz. At will call we find out that only two tickets were purchased and we needed three. Of course it is now sold out. One of the girls calls the concierge to find out what happened....they say this is a normal occurrence that the Alcatraz tickets are mixed up (what?!?) but they apologized for our waisted time and said we would have a gift waiting for us in our room. That evening we come back to the room to find that yet again it has not been cleaned........with no gift. We have now had it. We talk to a manager about it he of course apologizes and sends a bottle of wine and a stress ball and candle. We brush the afternoon off and get ready for dinner. We have been so excited to use the house car (a bentley) for dinner so we go downstairs 20 minutes before our reservation to let them know we would like to use the car. We over hear them ok-ing the couple in front of us to go out side the 2mile radius the car is limited to. We wait for over 45min. We start a new with the driver and he is amazing. We return and the valet now apologize for our wait and offer to buy breakfast. I feel like there were so many other smaller things that happened that really put a bad taste in our mouths about the St. Regis. The whole place is not horrible the restaurants, bars and of course the Remede Spa are top notch. I would NEVER stay here again but I would come back to the spa because they truly know how to make their guest feel special.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis is a safe bet for quality in SF”
Reviews.Author: jfwoodman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate wedding anniversary. Booked the Astor Suite, which I recommend. The room was modern, bordering on spartan, but very clean and a pleasant space to spend time in. The lighting is pretty dim (lamp only), but that wasn't a concern for us. We had a wonderful experience, start to finish. The private butler's English was a little shaky, but the staff throughout the hotel was very pleasant. Enjoyed wonderful 60 minute messages at Remede Spa, and had an incredible dinner at Ame - which was the highlight of our getaway. Fantastic food and service. Living in the Bay Area, Ame doesn't get much attention, likely because it is viewed as a "hotel restaurant". But it deserves its Michelin star rating. As others noted, city noise is high around the hotel, which I noticed the most in my spa treatment room (sirens and car horns do take away from the message experience). So ask for a higher floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SidB
Reviews.Content: The first time i stayed here it reminded on the Wynn in Las Vegas and better. Very personalised service. They know how to greet every person walking in. The rooms are fantastic. Remote controlled blinds, etc are some features. Love to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we are just getting older, but we LOVED this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa567
Reviews.Content: So, I had posted on the forums for "hip, trendy hotel" ideas other than the W near the Moscone Center......everyone pretty much shot down my thoughts of the St Regis fitting the bill, but it DID. We've stayed at the W before (and did again for a few nights this trip), but the St Regis feels so much more luxurious for the money. The furniture at the St Regis is better quality (the W furniture reminds me of IKEA), the bathroom actually has SPACE you can use, they give you shower caps, cotton balls, etc.....things you would expect for the price. We were in town for a very large video game developers convention (GDC). This may have led to the younger (most of the guests were 25-40), Silcon Valley vibe at the hotel during our stay, but it worked perfectly for us. We are Starwoods Gold members and even though we were on a conference group rate, we were upgraded to a large, lovely corner room, free WIFI, and given a 4pm checkout. The room was modern, sun-filled, and spacious. It had a great shower and nice separate soaking tub. On the 7th floor, you could barely hear some outside street noise which might bother a very light sleeper. We didn't really have any views, but that was fine. The hotel itself is right next the Moscone center and an easy walk to many restaurants, coffee places, shopping, and transportation. The downstairs bar/lounge area was hopping early to late afternoon, but then quieted down later in the evening. It's great little area to have a quick cocktail or meeting and actually be able to hear each other speak. If you need a more rockin' late night crowd, you can walk one block down to the W which carries on much later (and louder) into the night. The spa was lovely. Had a massage with Dennis Trump (I usually always go to a girl, but none were available. He did not disappoint).....what a nice guy!! At the end of the treatment, I asked him for some restaurant suggestions and he gave us some wonderful choices. The pool at the hotel is outdoor only so that was a bit of a bummer, but would be great in the warmer months. I would def. recommend this hotel for a romantic get-away or a business trip. I think this will probably be our go-to hotel in San Fran in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city hotels in SF”
Reviews.Author: TripNLuxe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over new years weekend and had a gret experience. Stayed in a grand deluxe room on the 20th floor over mission. View was nothing special but the room was large and very quiet. The pool and fitness facilities are clean and very nice. Staff is friendly but also leaves you alone, which I like. Overall a gret experience, but they fell short on the "allow me" service prior to our stay. Unfortunately none of my requests were acknowledged and as a gold preferred Starwood member, I was a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: luxevacationlover
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is everything you'd expect it to be - a wonderful stay in San Francisco. The Bentley house car was a nice perk, and the staff/service was impeccable. Not sure if it's worth the $$ premium, but I'll gladly stay there again on my corporate account.

Reviews.Title: “I Left My Heart at St Regis”
Reviews.Author: romazzino
Reviews.Content: I spent the most amazing 4 nights at this stunning St Regis! From arrival to departure the entire stay was just absolutely flawless. Every employee I encountered was just thrilled to help and cared about how my stay was. The bar scene is luxurious and vibrant. The cocktails delectable and the service top notch. The rooms are large and stunningly appointed with all the amenities you may need for your trip whether on business or pleasure. During my stay, I experienced the hotel's spa, Remede Spa. The facilities just like the rest of this San Francisco landmark are gorgeous with fabulous amenities. In addition, my massage was probably the best I have ever had thanks to my therapist Dennis. If travels take you to San Francisco, look no more. The St Regis will meet and exceed every expectation. You can thank me later!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch - as expected”
Reviews.Author: ForensicChick
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend on a surprise overnight to St. Regis SF (we're locals) with a goal of staying at all of the St. Regis Resorts. We had a corner suite on a high level and the room was absolutely amazing. Check-in was a breeze and the staff members were wonderful - as they tend to be at the St. Regis'. The room had a dining room, living room, office area, large bathroom with separate deep soaking tub and large bedroom. The bed was super comfortable and the components of the room could be run off of two remotes (bedroom and desk/office). We did not utilize the butler service but did use the valet multiple times and they were wonderful. The pool was across from the spa and a very clean, nice pool for being in SF and indoors. Overall - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Well Appointed, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: h2onab
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in San Francisco, the St. Regis excels in customer service. The staff are trained to accommodate guests with a smile, and they do. Rooms are comfortable stocked and with quality amenities. The bathroom has a separate tub where one can soak and in our experience, look at the 20th floor view of the City. The hotel is ideal for a weekend getaway. What limits the hotel from an "excellent" rating is the $50 plus tax parking fee and a $14.95 internet service charge. Hotels that continue to charge an internet fee is similar to airlines that charge for luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Luxurious Hotel with Urban City Sounds (Sirens)”
Reviews.Author: NorCal_Explorer
Reviews.Content: First surprise! We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room on the 13th Floor! The fact that they actually kept the 13th floor as "13" surprised us since so many hotels adhere to the old superstition. But no matter.... we felt completely pampered while staying at the St. Regis in San Francisco. Excellent, personable, and professional service throughout. From the lobby to the doorman to the staff at the Vitrine Restaurant to the butler service! The butler service impressed us the most! My husband forgot cufflinks for his shirt and asked to borrow some, but was told none were available at the time. Although, we had to improvise using other materials (we were running late for dinner reservations) we found a box of cufflinks in our room upon our return. They sent someone shopping at the nearby Macy's to get us some. Even though, it was too late, that kind of service was still very much appreciated! Thank you, St.Regis! Due to the closure of the Bay Bridge, we took the BART into the city and got off at the Montgomery station. It was super easy and there was no hassle with parking. Of course, we packed light and were able to walk the few blocks to the hotel. We loved the high end marble flooring, leather walls, and luxurious linens. We didn't hear much noise from others in the hotel room, but you could still hear the sounds of a big city below. So keep that in mind. 13th Floor was not high enough to buffer the sounds of sirens from fire engines and police trucks. But it was very quiet after midinight or so. So it is definitely a reminder - that while St. Regis SF is an amazing hotel, keep in mind that you are still in the heart of the big city.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a beautiful, but expensive hotel located within walking distance from AT&T park. The rooms were lovely, and the bar action was fun when returning from a night game! The walk from the hotel to the park was enjoyable, safe and just what was needed before enjoing a great Giants Game!!

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice and great addition”
Reviews.Author: drew3114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few years old and it shows in its modern design and clean look. The rooms are well appointed and the bathrooms just as good. I'm a big fan of the shower. While the staff still need a bit of work to reach the level of the Ritz up the road but they still do a great job. If you are in town for an event at the Moscone Center or are looking to attend the museum you couldn't pick a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel. Nothing special about location.”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1964
Reviews.Content: I am staying here right now (Feb 2012) on a business conference and have found he hotel to be comfortable and relaxed. The rooms are spacious (the wall to the bathroom that can be folded back helps to give an illusion of space) and quiet, and the public spaces of the hotel are relaxed. Staff are friendly and helpful. There is nothing special about the location - there's no view from the hotel or the surrounding area that you would write about - but the main shopping area is quite handy. All in all, a decent place for a conference but I wouldn't stay here on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: sharontognietti
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at St Regis Princevalle I was very disappointed in this property. Nothing Grand Delux about my room. For the price it was sub par. No Butler greeting no local car service no water offered. Will stay at the Westin or the W next time. The beddind was not the quality you would expect. Called housekeeping for a feather pillow as the foam ones on bed were hard as a rock. They brought me another foam pillow. Used a huge amount is star points and regret it,

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BonjourLL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2011, for 3 nights thinking it was the warmest time to come to San Francisco but be warned! It was freezing we did not take the right clothes, t-shirts and flip flops are too cold for SF. The hotel lobby was really modern but had a great atmosphere. The rooms were MASSIVE with a great view, we had a 2 bed suite overlooking the city, they were decorated very modern, however I felt they were slightly shabby and looked worn. The only thing that let the hotel down, was the breakfast. It was order not buffet and just isn't really worth the price, it's better to find somewhere on your travels. San Francisco is definitely a must see, and this hotel is great for touring as the location is ideal and the rooms spacious, for when you are rushing home to get ready to go back out again. Would definitely come back when visitng San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: fam4luv2travel
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Great location, right in the center of the city for shopping and across the street from a beautiful park for the kids. We stayed here for a week and the concierge was amazing. Everything from food delievery from specialty restaurants(sometimes we just wanted to eat in and watch t.v.) to lending us a baby carriage and helping to locate shops and sight seeing recommendation. Always with a smile. Gave us water for the drive down to Carmel. Would recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bliss!!!”
Reviews.Author: WBM
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful - such an amazing and beautiful property from lobby to rooms, to the impeccable service. I have stayed here twice and have received nice upgrades as an SPG-Gold member. Everything about this place is 5-Star - service, decor, cleanliness, and cost...lol ... yep, it is not cheap - but it's worth it for a splurge weekend! Just go!

Reviews.Title: “high class service.”
Reviews.Author: TimBudi
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Christmas Day, front desk staffs were great, greeted us and started to work on my check in process right away. They were able to upgrade me to a higher floor room. Clean modern lobby with touch of christmas decorations and there's always an open elevator on the lobby level ready to whisk you to your floor. The room was very nice, clean with a calming color tone. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were very crisp. Good amount of work space with a nice chair and good amount of lighting if you need to work at night. Seating area next and by the window were really nice. Plush bath robes and slippers. Turn down service was excellent. Bathroom area was fully stocked with towels and Remede bath amenities. The rain shower head was so great (i think all 5 star hotel should have this), i always want to take extra time while showering after a long walk around the city. The bath tub was nice and opens up to the bedroom and you will be able to watch TV while soaking in the nice size tub. If you need privacy you can close the doors connecting to the bedroom and enjoy a smaller TV in the bathroom. Fitness center is kinda small but nice. lots of cardio equipment. Pool was very nice. We really enjoy the pool for ourselves that night. Concierge service is at your fingertip and they were very helpful and knowledgeable. The door man was really nice and polite. There's always smile and greetings from all the hotel staff. They were very attentive and helpful. Location was great near to market street and convention center. The entrance and lobby was not as grand as their other properties. But again this is SF, space is very limited. I would recommend this hotel and will probably stay there again for christmas this year. It was a really great experience. Thank you St. Regis San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Love the room but not much else”
Reviews.Author: JMYH
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to a stay at the St Regis as we were celebrating our 10th anniversary. I booked a Deluxe room, filled in the butler form and made a few inquiries. After 6 weeks of silence, I wrote an e-mail to the butler service requesting for a reply to my inquiries. I received a most shocking reply, a non-sequitur, and no, this wasn't an automatically generated reply. I couldn't believe this was the famed St Regis Butler Service. I won't go into the details but have since written to starwood corporate service department and would like to hear back from the hotel management. To be fair, once we checked in and went past some very odd guest experiences (which I'll attribute to the butler we communicated with), the service improved tremendously. The other butlers, concierge, front desk, porters, etc were all professional and helpful. However, something just isn't quite right about the St Regis. The room per se was lovely, that is to say the bed, the bathroom area with the open tub, huge shower room, luxurious bath robe and slippers and view. That's it. I was surprised that such a high end hotel couldn't provide tea bags but could provide numerous sachets of coffee for free, didn't have a fruit bowl and no turn down delights. Room amenities didn't work well either. Our TV would switch channels to the default channel after some time and the temp control automatically reduced the fan speed after some time too, which made the room very warm in the middle of the night. I kept having to wake up to turn it back up. On our 3rd day, water from the shower leaked into the toilet and I also noticed that the light fixture in the toilet was dangling slightly off the ceiling. I should have brought it up right there and then but actually didn't fancy packing up and switching rooms, plus we didn't spend too much time watching TV or in the room anyway, so it's partly my fault for keeping silent. I guess I just had great expectations given the reputation and you know, it isn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “$150 for a <1hr. domestic phone call!!! Read the fine print”
Reviews.Author: carouge
Reviews.Content: Would anyone nowadays think that a call within the U.S. would cost that much? Most landlines now consider any call in the U.S. to be local, so when I had to spend a lot of time setting up an iphone with our IS Dept., I didn't think anything of it. I'd love to know the hotel's cost for connecting that call. In addition, I was charged for two internet connections ($15) to use my laptop and ipad, another $9 for a dropped domestic call (<1min.), and it took several weeks just to get copies of my bill sent to me by email. Sure, downtown hotels are expensive, but charges like this are unconscionable. Otherwise, the location is OK- several blocks walk to Market Street, not a tremendous amount very close to the hotel. The room was decent, but I'm not partial to the setup with an electronic shade that separates the bathroom from the main room- I find it's much louder than an actual wall when there's more than one person staying in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor security”
Reviews.Author: GA Jule
Reviews.Content: My husband recently returned from a whirlwind business trip where one night was at the St Regis. He and his coworkers arrived and stowed bags at front desk as room was not ready and they had a meeting. My husband's watch was stolen as was a wallet from some other coworker. I realize he probably should not have had his watch on his laptop bag from the flight, but it was - an atomic watch I gave him several years ago. I can't believe his coworker left his wallet in his bag, but he did. Still, hard to believe at a 5 star hotel, their luggage was pilfered and both were taken. Another coworker with nothing taken had mentioned to both of them he noticed when he picked up his bag the zippers were not the same as when he left them at the desk. Just a word to the wise, if you have to leave your bags before room is ready do NOT leave any valuables in them as well, the small stuff can disappear. That being said, he said it was a very plush and comfy place to stay....but they didn't seem too concerned his watch disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely done in a contemporary design and is fairly new. The reservation desk was very helpful. She was going to give us a standard room but took it a step farther to give us a suite for our anniversary. That is great customer service. After you check in the butler walks you to your room describing the hotel and room amenities. The room was fantastic with a great view as a corner room. Light and shades can be operated with a master control in the bedroom. The Regis hotel takes it to the next level in service. Room service was excellent and to top off our stay, they provided an anniversary cake. The hotel is close to shopping and a few museums. The doorman was friendly and helpful. Had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view.....great stay”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is located in the lively SOMA area of San Francisco. It is next door to the SF Museum of Modern Art which is great for the art, restaurant and gift shop. Also, it is walking distance to Union Square. The lobby is inviting with comfortable seating for drinks and light food. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with large glass windows that provide lots of natural light. We had a wonderful view of Yerba Buena Gardens. There is a central system to control temperature, lighting, shades and black out shades that is easy to use and conveniently located. The bathrooms are also large and beautiful. We had breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, called Vitrine's, our meal was not memorable but the service was excellent. The staff were professional, helpful and friendly. The only thing annoying about our stay was the charge for internet connection in the room. Other than that complaint, it is my new favorite hotel in San Francisco. It was heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: midavi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the St. Regis hotel. From the moment we arrived there until we left the service and attention to detail was impeccable. They upgraded us to a room with a view of the nearby park and had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us when we got there, courtesy of the concierge who knew we were celebrating our anniversary. Great touch! The hotel is beautiful and modern. The room was well equipped and had a nice modern touch. The concierge, Mariah, was very helpful in making suggestions to restaurants. We ended up going to Ozumo (Japanese) which was excellent! The location was also good. It's right next to Moscone center which is good if you are attending a trade show there, but it's also very close to Union Square and the shopping area. Easy to walk to. If you are looking for a nice place to stay which visiting San Francisco and are also looking for great service, the St. Regis is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, convenient location, snooty front desk”
Reviews.Author: Doctorg23
Reviews.Content: Cool room with recent updates. Convenient location to Moscone and downtown shopping. Close to a fire station, so sirens woke us up every night. The bell staff were friendly, but the front desk person who checked us in was snooty and bordered on rude, I think because we had booked under a group rate. There are plenty of other nice hotels close by (W, Inetercontinental) that are far less expensive and just as nice. I'd save your money for a nice dinner out.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: happytodoit
Reviews.Content: High tech, gorgeously modern room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed our 8 year anniversary weekend here and will happily return for another special occasion. I would highly recommend it. Being right next door to MOMA was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The location is good - less than a 5 minute walk to union square. The hotel is new and the rooms are outstanding except for a lack of HD channels. The service is very good but I cannot say excellent. It is hard to come up with any specific complaints but I just did not get the same feeling I do when I stay at a Four Seasons. Not sure whether the service was slightly impersonal, slightly slow, or whether it was something else. Overall my stay was very enjoyable and I would recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've stayed at in the US.”
Reviews.Author: Galindenba
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded us of the level of service we've come to enjoy in Asia. Five star in every way. Lovely pool area although an outdoor deck would be a nice touch. Great bar/lounge off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: sidak1313
Reviews.Content: Looking for a five star experience with personality? The St. Regis delivers, with perhaps our favorite rooms in San Francisco. Newly built in 2005, the St. Regis San Francisco boasts wonderful room sizes, personalized service and utmost attention to design throughout. The location is ideal, and centered in the heart of San Francisco, just adjacent to Moscone Convention Center, and a five minute walk to most shops, restaurants and culture. No hills to climb here. This St. Regis is stylish, sophisticated and contemporary. All guest rooms reflect a sophisticated residential feel, with impressive technology to match. We especially love the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “A well run San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycluxtravel
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a very well run hotel in San Francisco. While this isn't the best hotel in the world it provides the full luxury experience with a quality service delivery. Many of the kinks have been worked out over the past few years.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.More experience needed :)”
Reviews.Author: BlumaFelix
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many upper end hotels in the City and wanted to try the St Regis since we had such a wonderful stay in Aspen. This was far from a 5 Star. Our room was not ready and we arrived after 5pm. I was put on hold every time I called the front desk. Although, I there was free coffee offered at the restaurant on the 4th floor there was no coffee pot in the room. (I really like to have coffee in the room when I get up) Upon checking in they said it was no problem and that they would send one up. They did send one up-without cups or coffee and the fellow was embarrassed and returned with some. The next morning everything was removed, not replenished??? Most of the employees we very nice, but seemed new. In the evening the doorman could not catch a cab for us so we had to walk to the theatre center?? And the bell man was so slow with getting our bags when we were leaving and it was not a busy hour to leave..chit-chatting with the girls! Oh well, there are tons of other places to stay..but the location for conferences and museums was great.

Reviews.Title: “A top city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exosphere01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on our arrival into San Francisco before we headed down the coast. it is really well located for exploring the city and easy to get to in a taxi or driving from the airport. I think the decor is very well done for a busy city hotel - contemporary but arty/interesting as opposed to bland. The lobby bar was always busy and their restaurant Ame was fantastic. Our room was very nice. we had booked a deluke city view king room and it was very nice. Bright, light with all mod cons needed when travelling. The bathroom was open to the bedroom and seperated by the bath. We were on the 15th floor and the views were great. The pool and spa area are very nice and there is also a very good sized fitness centre. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my clients and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Well run neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjmit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a conference held at the hotel. My room was not overly large, but very clean and well appointed and the hotel services ran very well. The conference rooms were well setup, wi-fi everywhere, and its location in the city center within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants etc Don't expect any great views, you are in the center of the city, but staff were police and helpful and the bar had a nice vibe.

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel with high standards of service”
Reviews.Author: Edgar0
Reviews.Content: High class city hotel close to city, walking distance of main shopping and cable car. Great and consistent friendly service, high quality rooms and public areas and while appears pricey (for a Brit with current exchange rate) is actually good value - you can't get this quality in London for the rates I paid. Rooms very pleasant (I had a 15th floor deluxe room which was bordering on sumptuous) and great to sleep in, with wonderful linen, down pillows and marble bathroom. Ame, the hotel's restaurant, is serious fine dining. The hotel bar is fully stocked and has some great (and good value) cocktails and offers food from Ame restaurant (as does room service). There is a big pool, quality fitness centre and a spa. Really enjoyed my stay, would have been even better if for pleasure rather than business. Only fly in the ointment was that one (only) breakfast was not quite up to scratch, but that one small slip is forgiven for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Giant's Game”
Reviews.Author: Travelathon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when in town for a Giant's game. It's a beautiful, sophisticate hotel and I strongly recommend it if you want to be close to the south side of town. LOCATION: Close enough to walk to some excellent shopping on Union Square, close enough to walk to the Giant's game or to Moscone Center. ROOMS: Very sophisticated, automated blinds, all the touches you would find in the best Four Seasons. FOOD: We always order room service wherever we go, and the food was excellent, and the staff very professional and endearing in their earnest hard workingness. STAFF: Well served by all of them (the front desk people were the exception -jaded. OTHER: I stayed here when it first opened. The front desk made me feel so welcome and as if it were a true honor that I chose that hotel. They were proud to be there and that made me feel like I'd landed someplace really special. Now it's more "yep, same old, same old. here's your room key." Also, when you're an SPG and paying $650/night, please provide complimentary internet access.

Reviews.Title: “So close to perfection...”
Reviews.Author: MTVandendooren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend getaway at the St Regis in San Francisco. Overall, we thought this hotel was great. It's not inexpensive for sure, but there was a lot to love about it. The location was really good: 5-10 minute walk to Union Square (fantastic shopping there!), and a 5 minute walk to the Powell Cable Car that takes you to Fishermans Wharf. The hotel is lovely and modern. The rooms, though not large, have very comfortable beds, and were nicely appointed (though an in-room coffee maker would've been nice). The customer service, well...in a word, EXCELLENT. From the moment we walked in the door till the moment we left, ALL of the staff that we encountered from the front desk, lounge, Concierge, Ame restaurant, Vitrine restaurant, room service, to the Remede Spa were excellent. Courteous, professional, helpful, friendly and considerate. Everything I look for in a high end hotel... So...why only 4 stars you ask? The firetrucks. :( There is a fire station just a few doors down from the hotel, and unfortunately you can hear the sirens quite loudly (or at least we could from our room on the 12th floor). I was awoken 3-4 times in the night (every night) because of this. What a shame... Of course this is not the fault of the hotel, nor can they do anything about it (I don't think?), but it was definitely a negative for me. Perhaps on a higher floor, or on the other side of the hotel you can't hear it? If so, definitely stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: PK_in_KC
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels every week for business, and usually am fortunate to stay in excellent properties such as W and Westin. The St. Regis completely blew me away -- this place is simply fantastic. The staff was extremely attentive, the rooms very clean, roomy, and modern. The hotel is very well located in downtown San Francisco. The cost of amenities is proportionate to the quality of the hotel -- $60 breakfasts, $1500 champagne and caviar bath service. However there are plenty of excellent restaurants and coffee shops in the area, so no worries here. In this area I've stayed at the Palace (love it, but very historical ... old), W Hotel (excellent but small rooms) and Four Seasons. All are great, but this one takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Hotel in San Francisco is always a delight. Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff. Centrally located to Union Square, Market Street, SoMa restaurants and galleries. I tend to stay at the St. Regis and The Four Seasons every time I am in San Francisco. Great location. Walk anywhere or take a cab from this location with ease. Rarely, if ever, a disappointment at The St. Regis San Francisco. I prefer the Astor Suite and the Metropolitan Suite (I like the Presidential Suite but have not stayed in it). For more budget conscious travelers, standard rooms are clean, spacious, and perfectly acceptable in my opinion. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating as should be expected from any 5 Star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, too many working girls in the bar”
Reviews.Author: Spokesman
Reviews.Content: Of course, it's always a source of entertainment to watch professionals perfecting their craft, but it did get to be a bit much on the third evening of our stay. If not for this distraction, I'd give the place an excellent rating. Staff was helpful, rooms are very well appointed. And women clearly feel safe there. I saw the same women come in night after night....

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Room”
Reviews.Author: JTVancouver
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights and felt we were getting a really good rate for our room! Pros: Location - walking distance to everything Staff - very attentive, polite, friendly - awesome! Turn-down service was very good (included bottles of water) Great room - (20th floor), nice decor, comfortable beds, good soft & absorbent towels funky hotel bar pool looked nice - but we didn't get a chance to try it cool electronic touches - disturb/make up room signs were a buttom, the master room controls were all computerized on your bedside table Cons: no ironing board/iron in room no coffee/tea in room Very much enjoyed our stay, would 100% return, we had a great experience and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Many problems, rude staff, small rooms, whole hotel floor smelled of cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: LolaRose1234
Reviews.Content: I'm a marathon runner in extreme shape and I was accused of smoking by the management. When I told them I don't smoke they basically called me a liar. The WHOLE floor I was on stank of smoke. They tried to bill me $350 cleaning fee. LOL. American Express had to take care of the false accusations. Their management team is awful, extremly condescending. OH AND JULIE -- SHOULD BE FIRED ASAP SHE IS THE EPITOME OF FAIL. Here is my letter to the St Regis: The serious and shocking allegations leveled by management of the St. Regis hotel of wrong doing on my part involves smoking in a guest room. As I have told all parties involved, I DO NOT SMOKE, I HAD A LOVED ONE JUST PASS AWAY FROM CANCER.... I expect prompt attention to this matter. I have never ever been wrongly accused of smoking before, especially by a supposed 5 star hotel. These accusations have cause myself and my wife plenty of anguish and ruined our honeymoon. I am mortified and sincerely hope this is taken care of before I escalate this to the next level. Attached find my response to front desk manager Julie --: Hello Julie, Thank you for removing the mini bar charge. As I had told you at check out, we did NOT use the minibar. As for the $350 charge for smoking I don't know what your talking about? Neither myself or my wife smoke. We are marathon runners and smoking is not one of the things we do to train. A close relative of mine recently passed away from cancer, WE DO NOT SMOKE. At this point proof from the St. Regis is necessary that in your words "you and your guest appeared to have smoked in a non-smoking room". I am completely shocked....The first room we were given the whole floor smelled strongly of smoke, also we had no cell service. We asked to be moved promptly, which we were NOT and the second room also smelled musty / smokey in addition to being dirty. Also the whole 12th floor smelled of smoke. My wife and I had several problems staying at the St. Regis San Francisco . First was asking to be moved and our "butler", or the front desk dropping the ball. We checked in at 1pm and were not moved until approximately 7pm. The bathroom and the window ledge were filthy and we had to let housekeeping know to come and clean it again. There was never ice or water in the room, after we made a point to let housekeeping know we wanted it there. Several times we ran out of toilet paper and had to call the front desk, half a roll was left in the room and not an extra anywhere to be found. We ordered room service once, the order was all wrong, they forgot my fries with the sandwich, and also the dressing for my wife's salad. We had to wait another 30 minutes to get the ordered items, by that time the food was cold. Never once were we greeted by the doorman when we walked in after a long day. Both floors we were given rooms on smelled of smoke. The final problem was when we were checking out and you Julie -- were helping and there were bogus charges on my bill. This is extremely unprofessional and completely the opposite experience I've had at other St. Regis properties . I am a frequent traveler and I have never been treated so poorly by a supposed 5 star property. As I told you when I was checking out yesterday I am in Napa Valley for few more days of vacation. Your email this morning pretty much ruined my day. I would expect the St. Regis to solve this today amicably and issue a complete refund asap. I would like you to forward this email to the San Francisco hotel manager and St. Regis head office. I will be contacting them as soon as I return to Los Angeles .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent highend modern hotel near Moscone”
Reviews.Author: DrRonMath
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern hotel in the heart of SF near the Moscone center. Rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious with separate shower and bathtub with enclosed toilets. Should have double sinks, but that's my pet peeve. Service is supurb. Decor is very modern without being "in your face" flashy. Room controls (blinds, lighting, climate, etc) were very cool. Would definitely stay here again but would try to find discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms with great service”
Reviews.Author: spddemn
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at this hotel over the summer, was upgraded to the Astor suite and really enjoyed it. Excellent service from the staff and room service. They really seemed to go out of their way to make you feel special. We'll definitely be back again for a shopping weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love this place”
Reviews.Author: rdkflk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there many times. Rooms are exceptional. Furnishings and bathroom some of the best. Views are beautiful. Service great. Location - you could just stay in that part of town and walk everywhere with the SFMoma across the street! Spa is superb. Pool fun for all.

Reviews.Title: “A twist on Dinner and a Movie”
Reviews.Author: sslate
Reviews.Content: Whenever we attend a concert at Oracle Arena...we make a weekend out of it. We stay at the St. Regis in San Francisco. We love the rooms that overlook Yerba Buena. (...02 or 03 series on a high floor). Selena and her team at the front desk are always so kind and accommodating. Kathleen the concierge is AMAZING...she always helps us secure a car service from the hotel to dinner and then to the show....she even sends ear plugs just in case. Kathleen, Selena and the entire St. Regis San Francisco staff always make us feel special...I am a FAN!

Reviews.Title: “Yerba Buena Grand”
Reviews.Author: terere2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the past year and enjoyed both times immensely. Great service and beautiful upgraded rooms helped cement my opinion of this South of Market standout. We liked the pool and the beds were very comfortable. Convenient location next to MoMA, Yerba Buena gardens, Moscone Center, etc. Union Square or the Embarcadero/Ferry Building are 15-20 minute walks. I have high expectations of the upper tier of Starwood properties and the St. Regis delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Top Tier Hotel in SF With One Small Flaw”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 enjoyable nights at the well situated St. Regis San Francisco in a corner room. The room itself is top notch. There is a nice separate bathtub and a waterfall shower. The tub opens to the bedroom if you wish it to and there is a TV in the bathroom. The bedroom is modern and inviting with wood accents and neutral colors. The bed is comfortable, plush and has nice linens. The curtains are motorized and many things can be controlled from the console by the bed. The TV/entertainment system is very good with a dvd player and music connections. The internet was very fast! Room service was always on time! A few things to know. While the St. Regis clearly has one of best hotel rooms in SF you will pay for it. Rates vary wildly between $299-599 for a superior to deluxe room. Breakfast can easily set you back $40-50 per person. That said one should determine what represents value. For me $300 or so per night and I will stay here on a business trip. I may pay a little more for a romantic weekend visit. The bar is excellent and I suggest you have a drink. Ame is a great restaurant but keep in mind a bit hostile corkage policy of $25/bottle with no exceptions even if you buy $1000 in wine from them. As for the one small flaw I noticed, it is that the fire department must be nearby as woke to sirens each morning. Now keep in mind in a city this is not unusual but it was an issue. Notwithstanding, I will be back and I recommend the St. Regis SF.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - a worthwhile indulgence”
Reviews.Author: Alison K
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend during a trip to San Francisco - we were celebrating his birthday, so I wanted to book a hotel that was luxurious (but not stuffy) as a nice surprise. It was a wonderful experience: The hotel was clean, luxurious and modern. We were incredibly impressed with the service and attention to detail from everyone who helped make our stay more enjoyable. The rain shower in the bathroom was one of the best I've ever taken, and room service the next morning - while expensive - was delicious (and served at a table on china, too!) I didn't use the tub, but liked that there was a TV in the bathroom that you could watch while you soaked. I can only imagine that St. Regis hotels in other cities are just as beautiful, and can't wait until I have the opportunity to visit this (or any of their properties) again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Morgan021
Reviews.Content: We were in a corner suite and the views are amazing. The room was big with a nice open livingroom. great service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with the food”
Reviews.Author: effieclyde
Reviews.Content: I had a stylishly pretty room, with a bed that was more comfortable after I straightened out the bottom sheet. Noise was not a problem at all. But breakfast was -- very expensive, and scrambled eggs so salty I had a hard time eating any. Other items edible but nothing special. No time to ask that the eggs be redone. I left a note on the half-eaten eggs, and mentioned it to the desk when I checked out -- his reaction was a shrug. Don't use the valet parking unless you're okay with $60/night, with tax and tip. I used the Fifth and Mission garage, two short blocks away, for a total of $41 for a day and a half. The hotel would have charged me for two full days, or $120.

Reviews.Title: “Best hospitality, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: myqueen21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 5 nights. It was one of the best hotel we stayed, the hospitality, efficiency of concierge, room service, butler service, maid service, doorman, bellman, front desk staff, entire staff were really great and service was impeccable. Also they had account with a great car service and drivers they had were so helpful and nice. Rooms were large and clean. Bathroom was also nice and huge with seperate rain shower and bath tub. When you ask for something, they responded immediately and brought things up for us. They didn't have coffee maker in the room but brought it for us immediately upon request. TV didn't work, called batler service and enginner had to come up to fix it 3 times but a man was such a nice man. Defnitely stay here again when I return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not well insulated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LJOceanGrl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with very modern style. Too bad I could hear everything in the hall, people in the next room and street noise. I think the hotel is on a street that a fire station is on or uses often. We where on the 10th floor and could hear the road noise. Same goes for noise in the spa, not very relaxing to have a massage when you can hear cars, motorcycles and sirens. Service from hotel staff was excellent. Be certain to take the house car, a Bentley, to dinner. Lobby bar is great, try the tempura sushi. Spa service was excellent. Due to noise, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An easy pleasure”
Reviews.Author: skibunny-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (includes 2 grown boys) stayed here for 5 nights - location (next to MOMA) is good &our rooms were very nice - clean aesthetic with good lighting, terrific blackout curtains, pretty bathrooms, with a TV in the main room & in the bathroom. Terrific bed & pillows.The staff is very accommodating & the various people who work at the concierge desk are excellent. Best place to eat breakfast is directly across the street (very reasonably priced & delicious) - The Grove. The hotel's indoor pool was warm & very inviting (open 24/7), room service was efficient & the hotel staff made us feel very welcome. The only negative was the lack of in-room coffee/tea amenities. (Chocolates on the pillows with the nightly turn down service would have been a nice touch, too.)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: HUH42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way overpriced. Its nice but.... The air condition was not working properly, and the TV image was not sharp. I did not complain since I had got from a motorcyle trip and was very tired. Some friends had the same trouble and had to be changed to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and well-worth it.”
Reviews.Author: briansit
Reviews.Content: As a last minute getaway, we decided to 'go all the way' and 'all out' by booking an executive class flight to San Francisco to shop and dine to our heart's content. As the centerpiece of this trip, checking into the St. Regis was the highlight. Upon an earlier checking in, the room wasn't ready, but the front desk was more than happy to upgrade us to a larger corner suite on a higher floor. Every detail in the room (from the automatic blinds and lighting that we remotely controlled from your bedside, to the rain shower with good water pressure, the the high-quality bed... etc) was maticulously thought out. If you have the chance to stay in the room west facing on the 18th floor, the combined views of the bay and the rolling city skyline are magnificent. Oh, and why hail a cab when you can ride in a Bentley! Yes, this is what they use to shuttle guests to their destinations in the city. Having had the opportunity to stay in some of the best hotels around the world, this one is probably very close to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel that hits all of the marks”
Reviews.Author: bfelixg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the St. Regis for one night. We booked our room through the Amex Platinum Fine Hotels & Resorts program. Upon checking in, we were informed that we had received a complimentary upgrade to the Astor Suite. We enjoyed great cocktails in the chic bar next to the lobby, and our bags were promptly brought to our room, even with an offer to unpack them for us. The views from the Astor Suite are amazing, and the room is spacious to the extent that you feel like you are living in an apartment in San Fran - not staying at a hotel. While we were there, we also enjoyed the Remede Spa. I highly recommend the massages there. All in all, the hotel is in top shape, very clean and modern, with superb staff who have been well trained to treat everyone like VIPs. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Serendipityquest
Reviews.Content: Great location. Sumptuous beds, linens and towels. Awesome bath products. Indoor pool. Great gym. Lively bar. Spacious rooms. What would I change? The spa/hot tub/steam/sauna closes a bit early (I wish it was open until 11pm instead of 8pm or 9pm). TV's don't have sleep timers (I called and asked), missing in-room coffee makers, the room controls are a bit complex. The location and other amenities still make it my SF favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Central and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GAKill
Reviews.Content: Sophisticated, central location. Good service. Modern and clean room styling making the rooms feel light and spacious. Very comfortable beds. Powerful overhead shower. Very good indoor pool for the family. Well equipped gym.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice. Impeccable Service.”
Reviews.Author: firecrackerjulie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the St. Regis. The best part was a lovely room and the great staff here. We were on our way to the pool and a staff member in the elevator spoke with us. 10 mins later, she showed up at the pool with little robes for the kids. Location was great. 8 mins walk to the cable cars and lots of shopping. Wifi is not free, and parking is insanely priced...$58 dollars a day. Double what it costs just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, sophisticated hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 3fortheride
Reviews.Content: High level of service and attention to detail. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Make sure you order the 125 Club Sandwich. I had one small challenge during my week long stay and it was quickly addressed and resolved. There is a fire station located near the southeast side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: COJIII
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but feel compelled to write one after staying at the St. Regis with my son in San Francisco this week. In summary, our stay was simply outstanding. The last time I stayed at the St. Regis was 5 years ago in Beijing so I had forgotten how impeccable and personal the service is. Almost all of the staff called me by name, and they made my 10 year old son and me feel extremely welcome. I would like to highlight the front desk staff-especially Roxanne-for their professionalism and excellent service as well as Steven at the concierge desk. I look forward to returning to the hotel to experience its unmatched service!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite business hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Matt196
Reviews.Content: Everything you could want in a city hotel. Rooms are extremely comfortable, well designed and spacious. I am a Starwood Platinum member and a repeat guest and so a lot of the staff will greet me by name, always a nice touch. The hotel always does everything they can to arrange an upgrade but whatever room you get is very comfortable. The concierge desk is extremely helpful and efficient, even arranging 5 cases of wine to be collected, packaged and shipped to Singapore for me. Good location, especially if you are heading south to Silicon valley as 101 and 280 are easy to get to without fighting through city traffic. I will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I remember...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller R
Reviews.Content: The lobby feels like a W Hotel, but the rooms and the service are all St. Regis. The lobby area can feel a bit 'clubby' around the cocktail hour, but it is easy to escape upstairs to the serenity of the restaurant or your guestroom. The guestrooms are huge as are the bathrooms, and as elegantly appointed as you will find. The service, both in the restaurant and with room service, was warm but refined. You definitely get what you pay for, and it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: bblumberg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2011 for a meeting. My room was in the older part of the property but was well appointed and comfortable, particularly the bed. This hotel has the fastest room service I have ever experienced. I used it for a late dinner and 2 breakfasts and never waited more than 10 minutes from ordering to eating. Remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-lavish blandness”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets very high marks for delicious food and a serene atmosphere. Employees are intelligent, capable and motivated.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet luxury”
Reviews.Author: JPMar
Reviews.Content: A true 5 star hotel! I must say that this was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The room, the service, the facilities and the location were all fantastic. My girlfriend and myself loved how discreet and luxurious the hotel was without being pretentious. I don't know what others on here are saying about the noise- it was so quiet, and the amenities in the room were first rate. We didn't go to the restaurant, but the bar can make a great cocktail. I will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good, if not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: While I am still fond of the St Regis (especially after trying the Mandarin), it seems to be slightly decreasing in quality. The rooms are still pleasant and light with good views, but the furniture can sometimes be a little nicked (and some of the layouts always were impractical.) The bathrooms are wonderful. The food is fantastic, both for room service, at the restaurant and in the lobby (which is a great meeting spot if a little party-like at times.) The service is good but not amazing, sometimes overly casual(yes, I know, it is San Francisco, but still) and chatty, even uninformed in a couple of situations at the reception and concierge desks. Still a very good bet unless the prices continue to rise.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RaviVacation
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best business hotel I have stayed at. The location is right next to the convention center and therefore you will see a lot of business travelers instead of families. The rooms were just phenomenal and the view from the 14th floor was great. The cost is quite steep but if that is not a constraint then the location, service, comfort are definitely worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, plush hotel”
Reviews.Author: willmcinnes
Reviews.Content: Just an amazing experience staying here. From the minute I walked in past the buzzy upmarket bar and approached the front desk all the way through to checking out today it was perfect. Amazing customer service throughout including at the bar, in the Ame restaurant, the doormen. The room was fantastic - fourteenth floor views of the city, and a sliver of the Bay Bride - incredible bathroom, great facilities. And to top it off one night me and some of my fellow conference attendees were heading out to a bar and the doorman arranged for the hotel car to take us for free: a $250k Bentley. Unbeatable! So yes, if you can afford the budget I wholeheartedly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suites, small pool”
Reviews.Author: justsun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times, this tends to be our preferred hotel when visiting SF. However, we have had various experiences. Whenever we get an upgrade to a suite (most of the time), the experience is amazing. We love the comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, the amenities, and the rooms. Their standards rooms are just fine. It is still better than most, but after getting spoiled with the suites it is almost disappointing to not get upgraded, especially when you are celebrating a special occasion like your engagement anniversary. Being platinum members we became spoiled with the privileges. Valet is steep: $50 if I remember correctly, and tip of course. Typical SF, but it's unfortunate that you have no choice other than to valet should you choose to have you car on the premise. There is a parking garage nearby (few blocks) for 50% less. It's nice to have a Peet's right across the street. The Italian market is also great for picking up snacks or a simple dinner to enjoy in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggNY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed over at the St Regis San Francisco downtown during the last week of April for four nights (Thurs/Fri/Sat/Sun) for a long weekend. The hotel is conveniently located in the San Fran downtown area with walking distance to pretty much all of the attractions in the city. The hotel itself is modernly decorated and well maintained, with an atmosphere that is almost more like ones typically seen at Mandarin Oriental than St Regis. We booked a Metropolitan Suite and the room was very specious, with a nice dining table and comfortable L shaped couch. All of the phone dialing and lighting were controlled by digital pads. The bathroom was bright and nicely done as well. Although there was not a second bathroom we were pleased to see two sinks in the spacious bathroom. So with such a nice hotel, how come I only gave it three stars? First it had to do with room service. Both my bf and I are late risers and thus we ordered breakfast in every morning during our stay. Although the food itself is delicious, getting the food itself is not such a smooth process. There is only one day, out of 4, that the room service department got our order right. The first day they missed the pastries. The second day they miss the Maple Syrup (to go with pancake, which is stated in the menu and should come without a special request). On the third day, even though I specifically asked for some honey to go with my French toast over the phone, the honey was missing when the order came. I understand that this may not be the delivery personâ€™s fault and feel bad that we have to send the person back every single time to pick up the missing items, but the person who took the order and the person packing the order should really take the responsibility of checking the completeness of every order. Since this is a five star hotel that charges 21% of service charge (& I believe there is a $5 delivery fee in addition to that) for room service, this type of service is really Not acceptable. A 5 star hotel should be able to â€œearnâ€� its 21% service charge instead of getting it by default. It was especially disappointing that when we addressed this issue during check out, we merely got an answer of â€œoh we are surprised to hear that and will address this issue with room serviceâ€� without a word of sorry or any apology from a supervisor (which is surprising to see for a five star hotel). There are a couple of other things in addition to that. In terms of the room itself, although the room is nice/bright/high tech as previously stated, there was a huge crack in one of the sinks (and I have a picture to prove that) that was obvious there since the installation of the sink. Although it did not affect the functionality of the sink, it was surprising for a guest staying at a room with rack rate of over $1k a night to see that in the bathroom. In terms of the hotel service, although the service mostly live up to the name of a five-star hotel, has its high and lows. The staff at the Concierge desk (I believe his first name is Steven) was extremely helpful and gave us all sorts of tips in addition to the maps and explained thoroughly with regards to different ways to get to places. On the other hand, the bell guys at the Parking area were not nearly as nice and often opened the door with a stone cold, annoyed face. Overall we definitely enjoyed the room and the location of the hotel and had a wonderful time in San Fran. However there are a few things (as stated above) that really need to be addressed by the hotel management for us to consider staying at the hotel again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but for the price, should be better.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a deluxe room. Have previously stayed in executive premier room. The executive premier room is not worth the extra price, as the rooms are about the same size and have the same amenities. The rooms are very modern and clean and spacious. However, there is a lot of street noise, enough to wake anyone but the soundest sleeper up a few times each night. The Taxi situation is miserable. That is because the hotel is not on a street where Taxis travel much. Allow for about 10 minutes for a cab, but could be much longer if there is a line. The hotel was unhelpful when I called the 'butler' to ask for them to call a cab for me, in the hope I would not have to rely on one being flagged down. The butler told me that they had cabs lined up and there would be no wait, which was completely false. There were no cabs lined up and it took 10 minutes to get one. I was actually very unimpressed with the 'butler' service advertised heavily by the hotel. I thought I might watch a DVD and called the 'butler' hoping he could bring by the list of DVD's the Hotel keeps on hand to loan. That was completely nixed. I was told that I would have to go downstairs to the front desk to see the list. Not very 'butler-esque', in my opinion. Why call them butlers if they are not going to go out of their way to help? Another strike-out was when I called to ask whether they had any materials I could have to wrap a small gift. Now, I know that sounds a little prima-donna-ish, but I have asked at another hotel and they were able to help with this. Actually, I hear from a friend who works in a hotel that most hotels have some wrapping paper on hand for their own use. Anyway, my request was refused, actually I felt they ridiculed me a bit for it. For the prices they charge at this hotel, I hoped hey might consider actually trying to go the extra mile for their customers. Unfortunately, after three visits I can say that for the money, you get a nice room, but also some noise and totally unimpressive customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: ScarsdaleStampman
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have said, this place is great. We had the Astor Suite, tiny, tiny closet, not cheap either, but they were gracious and gave us a bigger suite, not a great location but huge closet, so it worked for us, and here's the but. 2 things, valet parking is a small fortune (50 plus tax 57 per night) and they put a hold my credit card over $1,000 more than the room charge would be ( my contracted rate was about 1,900 for the 4 nights, they put a hold of $2,900 on my card at check in) but DID NOT INFORM me of this. I found it out AFTER I was at the airport and I was emailed the "final" bill which showed the bill the handed me and then this $2,900 charge, I thought it was mistake until I got home and called. The hold was released on check out but I was never informed. This never happens at Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. Shame on them

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews about noise seem to be accurate.”
Reviews.Author: mafitch
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, the bar scene was very lively and the drinks were good. The room was nice and compared to other St. Regis properties I'e stayed in, this has more of a Mandarin Oriental vibe to the decor. The bathrooms are small-ish but use the space very effectively so that two people can be in there at once at not get in the way. Even late at night and on the 11th floor, there was considerable noise from the street and in the morning before out wake up call it was worse. I did not the get paper I was promised, nor the extra luggage rack we requested upon check-in but the bed was comfortable and I slept reasonably well despite the fact that the air was set to 65 and never got below 73. The comfort of the bed was fair. The concierge was efficient in booking our car service for the airport but didn't seem overly interested in doing it, truth be told. The location is convenient to shopping, the Museum of Modern Art and the Embarcadero in a nice flat part of the city (unlike the Ritz Carlton), but I was not overly impressed with the service or the noise level of the room. I ended up paying 416 for the night all in.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_Hollins
Reviews.Content: I will join the chorus here. The St Regis is the finest Hotel in San Francisco. The Service provided by the staff is outstanding. I had a Metropolitan Suite which provided enough room to host a family visit. The suite has a dining room table for four. Whatever time of day I contacted the Butler Service I received immediate attention to my request. Room Service is expensive, but the orders were filled accurately and the food was delicious. The hotel is very attractive and features a modern design which carries over from the public areas to the rooms. The well designed baths are also notable. You will enjoy your stay at the St. Regis; I guarantee itl.

Reviews.Title: “A great place close to Moscone Center”
Reviews.Author: GVendryes
Reviews.Content: An amazing place fully equipped to make your stay the most quiet one. All is set in a way that you feel independent if you want to (no over service or constant inquiry about your satisfaction), but personnel remains immediately available when you just start thinking you need them. From that perspective, a great place to stay for business purposes and if you already know quite well SanFran.

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: mockje
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis in San Francisco is a top notch hotel. From the moment you step out of your car, you will be greeted with friendly service. The staff was very helpful throughout our entire stay. From the moment you walk in the door, you'll realize this is a luxurious establishment. Everything throughout the hotel is steeped in architecture, style, and quality building finishes. Our room was generously size for a hotel in downtown San Francisco. Everything in the room was electronically synchronized. For those who shy away from modern day technology, this may be a learning curve. The wife and I found it very useful and seamless. The rest of the room and bathroom were beautifully done with a great soak tub and rain water shower. All in all, our experience was very good. I would caution those who are on a lighter budget as the typical room price is indicative of the extras available in the hotel. If you are traveling to San Francisco for the experience, you won't go wrong with the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Charged me for Wifi even though I am Starwood Platinum member”
Reviews.Author: retinadoc52
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 weeks there in August last year. The hotel is nice, however, they charged me for Wifi even though as a Starwood Platinum Member it is supposed to be free. I did not pick it up on my bill and they never reimbursed me despite emailing them and even visiting personally.Not even a response. BE SURE TO CHECK YOUR BILL before leaving! I now prefer staying at the Westing on Market Street. Better prices and same location.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: a_nadeau
Reviews.Content: I do travel a lot and this is the best hotel I had experienced for a long time! Service was incredible and staff was very helpfull. I wojld go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lac555
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the SF St Regis since it opened. We have stayed at several other hotels in SF and always return to the St Regis. The staff is cordial and professional without being stuffy. Rooms are roomy and well lit, with good work areas. The location is excellent and within easy walking to shopping, dining, and the financial district. The rooms are starting to see a bit of wear, but not nealy as much as most other business hotels. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: EricTsukamoto
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis was a great experience from the beginning. We checked in and were taken to our room promptly. The girlfriend and I decided to come up to visit some friends over the weekend and for some relaxation which the St. Regis definitely provided. Everything in the room is controlled by a remote which was convenient. The showers were rain showers which were very relaxing. Room service was prompt and the staff was amazingly friendly offering us tips about getting around and good times to do things. I one of the staff know that I would need to be making a number of calls for business and that I had heard that ATT had bad service in parts of the hotel and they did their best to accommodate the issue. We took advantage of the free courtesy car service to head to a dinner with some friends which was a nice touch. The chauffeur was very friendly and was conversational (the pleasant way not the awkward way) Each night we were greeted when we returned and one of the staff took it upon him to remember my name and would greet us and personally go out of his way to provide transportation to wherever we were going. I will definitely be returning to the St Regis. (One small complaint that I do have is that when we arrived no one greeted us or took our bags. But thats just a small inconvenience.)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service but noisy and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Desk-Escape-com
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Regis for the last few days of my living and working in San Francisco - we had moved out of our apartment and shipped our stuff so wanted to stay somewhere great for our last few days. The service and quality of the rooms did not disappoint! Both were excellent, as expected given the price of the rooms. However the room service and breakfast were VERY expensive. Also the only poor service we received was at breakfast - definitely do not eat there! There is a cafe over the road called The Grove, which is good quality and value - try there instead. The location was great but noisy, which disturbed sleep, I know this is not the fault of the hotel - they can not help the noise of the city, but it is something to be aware of. I had a great massage in the spa and a lovely swim.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and noisy”
Reviews.Author: CAPickyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Wow, the pricey room rate is just the beginning! This is a very expensive hotel. Expect to be sticker shocked if you take anything from the mini bar ($15 for a bar of chocolate) or watch a movie ($18!). Breakfast is about double the price as what you would expect at another luxury hotel. A room service salad is $30 plus 21% gratuity and additional service charges. Given the St. Regis is a very upscale hotel, I was shocked that there was a group of loud, late night partiers down the hall screaming and drunk. I had to call security twice: once at 2:30am and once at 10am the next day. I found it difficult to fall back asleep after the late night disturbance. Also, even though I was on a very high floor, I still heard a lot of street noise, especially when the local bars closed at night. Overall, I can't see myself returning. I just didn't find it to be good value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot compare with other luxury hotels.”
Reviews.Author: jackforrest13
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent- pleasant and helpful. The room( a suite) was starkly furnished so that it was unpleasant and some areas were shabby. Lighting was poor. The 'can't read comfortably because the hotel is saving electricity style' which I expect in budget accommodations. We usually stay in the comparably priced Mandarin Oriental which has always been excellent. The St. Regis is many notches down.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueOcean7
Reviews.Content: My platinum status earned us an Astor Suite upgrade. Nice and spacious for our New Year's Eve night out. We also got a bottle of Moet & Chandon Champagne and 8 Charles Chocolate truffles. Yum! It's a very modern St. Regis with all the technology amenities as well as a very comfortable bed. I took my 18 month old son to the pool which he enjoyed. The water warm enough for a toddler. AME restaurant downstairs is amazing. Delicious food without being too pretentious. There is a firehouse a block or so away so it can get noisy for people who aren't used to being in a city but it was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: First of all let me explain that we didn't stay overnight since we left the hotel approx. 30 minutes after check-in. We've arrived from airport in the evening, approx. 20:30. When checking in we've been informed that the hotel was sold out and therefore, even I'm holding Platinum SPG status, we would get only a Grand Deluxe room - but top floor (20th). Holding Platinum status, at US$ 389.00++ there isn't even breakfast included nor is there a Club Lounge with all-day snacks, drinks... When entering the Grand Deluxe room I asked myself where they've lost the "Grand". The room was small, maybe one of the smallest I've seen at SPG during the last year. But okay, we didn't come to SFO to stay in the room and therefore I decided to stay. But when the bellboy left and we sat down we realized a big noise. I switched off the aircon - but the noise remained. I means not a bit of noise, I mean real noise. According to what I understand this noise was caused by the aircon located on top of the roof - just above our room. I called the front desk and they told me to send a technician. But nobody came. I called again and informed again about the noise. The manager at the front desk told me he trusts me - but he couldn't do anything about it. I asked if they'll let me go to another hotel and he agreed. The only positive I can say about the St. Regis in SFO is that they brought us with their hotel car (free of charge) to the Ritz Carlton where we got a beautiful room with Club Lounge access (fatastic!!!) at just US$ 30++ more. Conclusion: a) don't accept a top-floor room b) don't stay at the St. Regis if you expect a 5* experience - because 5* means more than a nice lobby and room c) if you can spend 10% more go to e.g. the Ritz-Carlton and get a Club Floor room with all the benefits

Reviews.Title: “new swanky property in seedy part of town”
Reviews.Author: flaviator
Reviews.Content: If you're on expense account, then you can stay here. Otherwise, it's over the top for its price/value ratio. I'd rather stay at the Ritz for the same service and much better value. Plus, the immediate neighborhood is a little seedy. The Bentley for local transport is nice, when it's available. Overall, great accommodations, but just exorbitantly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFam3
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel, first of all it is very centrally located to Union Square in San Francisco, and it's right next to MOMA. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms have a huge oversized bathtub with a window to look out onto the city. We thought the whole stay was very romantic and lovely. The bellmen/front desk and valet were all so accomodating and truly had our best interest at heart and since we had stayed their before they upgraded the view of our room. I would very much recommend this being a stop during your trip.

Reviews.Title: “It Earns Every One Of Its Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis San Francisco is a highly sophisticated, elegant hotel. The place is pitch perfect â€“ service is refined and attentive, dÃ©cor is warm and contemporary, and the rooms are spacious and comfy. There are gadgets galore (though it did take me five minutes to figure out how to close the drapeâ€¦hint: electronic console near the bed). Room service exceeds my expectations and the lobby bar was fun and lively. So â€“ any faults with this five star gem? Well, Iâ€™m not in love with the location, oddly there were no electrical outlets near the desk in my room and it is pricey. I often stay at the Ritz in SF and while I love the Nob Hill location of the Ritz, the St Regis is a far better value and is much more up to date - - definitely the better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the beds are a-ma-zing!”
Reviews.Author: tibibae
Reviews.Content: I went to SF for a week and I stayed at the St. Regis for a few days! I love the rooms, the ambience, the location.
