The Room Service wasn't great, the food was really good but the server just left the food and left, no introduction, nothing... I had a treatment at the Remede Spa and it was wonderful! Customized massage really amazing. I really didn't want to leave! The parking was pretty expensive in my opinion, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel79
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two young kids (2 1/2 year old and 6 month old) stayed here for 3 nights on a weekend getaway. We arrived at 12pm and our Astor Suite was not ready, so we were upgraded to the Metropolitan Suite. The front desk definitely took into consideration that we had young kids and need our room immediately. The room was luxurious yet comfortable, the best hotel bed we have slept in. The room service was spotty. Breakfast and dinner were good, but lunch not so much. The location is great, an easy walk to Union Square. Overall, service was spot on. Always, offering to accommodate us in any way. The property is elegant with a clean modern design. Overall, it was a wonderful stay, well worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: tstss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite & it was nothing short of luxurious! Our butler,Archie, was amazing! Room service food was delicious! We will ALWAYS stay here when in SanFran!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay in the middle of SF”
Reviews.Author: lolainlondon
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is incredibly stylish and modern, but not so much that it feels cold or uncomfortable. The service was impeccable, worthy of a true five star hotel. We were upgraded to an executive corner room which included two walls of windows with views of the city. Absolutely breathtaking. The rooms are quite large, especially for a city hotel, and impeccably clean. The beds and pillows were so comfortable we hardly found the strength to get out and sightsee. There is also a fantastic, albeit small indoor pool and spa. Overall, the St. Regis is truly a luxurious experience. The only real downside is the parking, which is $50.00 per night! There is a parking garage across the street though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Luxury with a slightly stuffy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: IndieNomad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very luxurious, modern and clean. Loved the lobby area and bar with the fire pit surrounding the seating area. The rooms were very spacious and nice, with an entryway and large walkin shower. Overall the experience was great, but if you want to let loose and actually relax on vacation, the atmosphere is a bit stuffy. The location was great, we walked to the pier for the farmers market and across the street for breakfast at a lovely cafe.

Reviews.Title: “pampered stay”
Reviews.Author: docmama1
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at the St. Regis to attend a medical conference at Moscone convention center. It was my first stay at a St. Regis property. I was traveling alone and was looking forward to staying at a nicer hotel than normal for a medical conference. I was not disappointed! The location was a nice 5-10 minute walk to my meetings. The hotel is fairly new and has a modern asian cosmopolitan feel. It seems to cater to the business travelers. Every part of the hotel I visited was spotless. My room was immaculate. The bath was luxurious with a soaking tub, travertine marble shower with rain shower. There were plenty of soft towels, bathrobes and a flat screen tv in bath. Housekeeping was great with turndown service every night. The bed and linens were amazing. I heard sirens during the day but I didn't notice any at night, guess I slept really good! I liked the touch screen controls at the bedside for the blinds, lights, temperature. The radio wasn't that great, not great reception, no ipod dock. The only thing I didn't like about my room was the view. I had a fifth floor room with a view of the air conditioning vents and of people in the museum of modern art looking out and taking pictures. I found out later when I visited the museum that there was a where's waldo sculpture on the roof of the building behind the hotel! I asked for a different room with a better view after I checked in, but was politely told that there were no other rooms available due to the conference. I had expected to maybe get a smaller room since I was paying the conference rate of $349 night. So, I kept my blinds closed the whole trip. I paid for internet the first night then used the free local sites the rest of my trip at Starbucks and the Grove. I spent two post conference evenings in the Remede spa getting a pedicure and a massage. The spa was very relaxing, with very nice friendly staff. I loved the champagne and chocolate truffles! The infinity pool was very cool! I used the fitness center one night to work out. I thought it was clean and well serviced. I ate dinner at Ame and had a very nice meal with amazing service. I also had dessert and a drink in the bar one night. It was a weeknight with a calmer, quieter crowd, unlike the weekend when the bar was packed. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel like California Pizza Kitchen. It's San Francisco so there are coffee shops on every corner, Peet's and Starbucks. The Grove is a really cool restaurant next door that serves all day and has wireless internet with your meal. I had the best chicken pot pie I have ever had there! There is a walgreens a half a block away, and an italian market across the street where you can buy a bottle of wine or get deli food. As a single woman, I felt very safe walking around the immediate area of the hotel and convention center. I only saw a few street people, not as many as I had expected. The area around the hotel seems a bit saner than the Union square area. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to stay here again. I felt very pampered and well cared for! All the staff I encountered were friendly and professional. The doormen were friendly and welcoming. It isn't a place I would take my family on vacation, and it probably wouldn't appeal to everyone. But, for the solo business travel or for a couple it is very nice. It is definitely for the traveller that expects a higher level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just not as nice as hoped for....”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Rooms are relatively spacious, location is right in downtown, valet was fine though cheaper alternatives are available 2 blocks away if you plan to use public transportation most of the time. Bellman were excellent as was housekeeping. The front desk is in need of retraining for platinum status guests after the difficulties i encountered with not honoring 4pm checkout, not asking or posting the platinum amenity, and the attempt to keep upgrades to a minimum of 1 category IMHO. You may hear fire engines quite likely depending on fate as i heard a decent number of them over my 3 night stay. Pool water was very clean and decently sized.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, efficient and great stay”
Reviews.Author: bizwarrior
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference at the St. Regis, SF. The welcome from each of the staff members was polite and open. Great and easy check in, room was great. I love the "zen" sort of pan-Asian decor. Tasteful and soothing. Lots of nice touches in the room. I did enjoy the spa and had two treatments there. Wonderful. No hard sales pressure or anything like that. The pool is quite wonderful and another peaceful zone... easy to get around the city and the concierge gave us a great restaurant rec that we loved. Had drinks in the lobby bar that were quite good. It was a really satisfying hotel experience. Luxury, efficiency and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going for a convetion, O.K. ...”
Reviews.Author: riblet80
Reviews.Content: This was our first and last stay at the S.F. St. Regis. My wife and I went for a romantic weekend from 9/23 - 9/27. We did not realize it was "Oracle Week" at Moscone Center, right across the street. Huge convention. It was jam packed at the hotel, but that was not their fault. We reserved an executive premier king, which is supposed to be one of the larger rooms. Our first room had a smashed table lamp and bacon crumbs on the duvet cover. The carpet had dirt on it. We had to wait at check in for the room while it was being "inspected". Some inspection. They clearly did not wash the duvet cover or vacuum the room. We complained and they moved us to a different room that was absolutely smaller with no seating. We complained again and were told that it was the last room available and that it was the exact same size as our previous room, it was not. It was definitely a down grade. We are Starwood gold members, but the front desk did not want to hear from us again, they were overwhelmed, so the director of guest services (Ken/Kevin?) called. He was extremely polite and professional, he apologized profusely. He offered 100/night off our bill because there were no other rooms available, (Oracle week), so we accepted. We really did not have a choice. The 100 off per night was nice, but we really like nice hotel rooms, and this kind of ruined it for us. We had planned to have some friend's up for cocktails because they wanted to check out the St. Regis, but since there is no seating in the room we met in the bar. We were embarrassed to show them our room. Some of our main complaints about the room: there is no I-Pod docking station in the room. Shocking! This is San Francisco, Apple/ tech center of the world. You have to clumsily plug your I-Pod into the back of the T.V. after calling the internet butler to get a cable. The T.V. is your stereo system. Lame. The bathroom only had one sink, there should be two at this category of room The closet is miniscule, we had to jam our clothes in. You have to call for an iron and board. There should be one in every room. These rooms are clearly designed for a single traveler attending a convention right across the street, and if that is the case, and your company is picking up the tab, it is convenient. There is no luggage storage. The lighting is dim. The bedside room controller (clock, phone, lighting, automatic drapes) is clumsy and awkward to use. (If you have ever stayed at a Peninsula Hotel, they have those system controllers down.) They charge 14.95 per 24 hour use of internet. That is a robbery when you are spending 550/night (plus a whole host of taxes and fees, not their fault). There is free internet access pretty much everywhere in S.F. Overnight parking is 50/night, ouch. Also, BEWARE, the hotel is right next door (literally) to a very large fire station. The trucks/ambulances come and go all night long, sirens blaring. It is very LOUD and we wore ear plugs. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. The rain shower in the bathroom is the best I have ever encountered, very strong with tons of water, and I don't usually like rain shower heads. The staff is excellent and friendly. You never see a maid's cart in the hallway, very classy. We left our room for about 30 minutes and the entire room was made up upon our return. They are a little stingy with soap/ shampoo, when the soap in the shower is down to a sliver, they should leave a new bar. Plus we left 10/day on the nightstand for the maid. Whatever. Great turn down service in the evening. Room service is excellent. The restaurant AME off the lobby is incredible and highly recommended. Great crudo and seafood, loved our waiter. If you are going for a convention at Moscone Center and your are alone, it is convenient. If you are going for a romantic/leisurely weekend with a loved one, this is not the place. Go to the Mandarin (incredible views) or the Ritz (very classy) and both are quiet with well proportioned rooms, although much more traditional in decor.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here. I stayed over the weekend and it was a wonderful experience. The room was spacious and very comfortable. And I even had a partial view, which was spectacular. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again if I decide to stay in the city over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Every star earned!”
Reviews.Author: thenrynunez
Reviews.Content: Between the two of us having stayed at some of the best hotels in the U.S. and the Caribbean, we both are in 100% agreement that everything about this hotel was great! The staff was extremely polite, friendly and attentive...they even hesitated to have us enter our room until a spot on the carpet was removed! The concierge desk was also very helpful in getting us on tours and into restaurants. The room and the view from the room was amazing and the house car was the best! We almost didnâ€™t want to leave our room let alone the hotel. We were so comfortable/happy that we didnâ€™t even hear the fire trucks after the first time :). It's never easy to mix classy with trendy and comfortable & they were spot on, we would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: prettyprettylady
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, but not great. We were given the wrong room at check in, but it was quickly sorted out. The baths are described as â€œdeep soaking tubsâ€� â€“ this is absolutely incorrect, they are not deep at all and they are quite short tubs. The shutters into the bathroom are really unique and one of the reasons I was attracted to the hotel, however, we had to keep them closed, as every so often you could hear a really really loud noise of running water from bathrooms around ours The maid service is absolutely impeccable and the little touches from the maid are really lovely (e.g. laying your toiletries out, folding up clothes that were piled on our suitcases) Loved the bedside control and the electric shades, the blackout was great. Didnâ€™t hear any noise from fire engines, etc â€“ slept really well, especially with the blackout blinds. The rainfall shower was great, I really miss that! Great pressure and the cubicle (including bench) was huge. The pool area was another thing I felt let down by. There were used towels and glasses and cups scattered everywhere â€“ it obviously isnâ€™t regularly attended to. We had a Deluxe guest room, so I wasnâ€™t expecting the St Regis Butler to be fawning over us, but at no point was this service mentioned to us or offered to us, and at no point were we contacted by a Butler.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlexaR
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations! Staff was great. Luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: quirdavi
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference in San Francisco, which was across the road from the St Regis, so in terms of location it is hard to do better. The Staff were very friendly and helpful in recommending some restaurants, etc. The Rooms were very clean and spacious. It is great to stay in a hotel that provides loads of towels and pillows. The bar has an intimate feel, but was still very lively each night. My only complaint was to do with the expensive Internet service. While I do not mind paying for internet access, I do expect it to work. It was clear that the service was not able to handle the demand and was unusable between 5pm and 10pm each night. I had to give up and set my alarm for 2am in the morning, when I was then able to do some work that I needed completed. So my advice it not to pay for the internet service and user your mobile phone or mobile connection for your PC.

Reviews.Title: “hold on”
Reviews.Author: jcski18
Reviews.Content: the corner suite you are looking at a wall... the window is full with a tv.... the cell service is non exsistant.... the lobby is like one large party of men and very noisey.... when you complain the answer is WE KNOW ABOUT IT.... when you ask about making telephone call they say you can make a call at ATT RATES for an operator (most expensive service).... the 800 there is a charge for each call.. great for business.... personel is marginal... I will be going back to tTHE FOUR SEASONS HOTEL in SF, Ca...

Reviews.Title: “Compared to the Four Seasons & the Ritz Carlton...”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: Over the past year, I've visited San Francisco several times and have stayed at each of the five star establishments in town. Overall, the St. Regis wasn't bad, but there are a few shortcomings. Service - the staff was friendly and very helpful. I did not experience any problems with those at the front desk. I was always greeted warmly and provided with the assistance needed. Definitely better than the Ritz Carlton, where staff seemed as if I was an annoyance. My main issue with the St. Regis was with the concierge on duty, as they all appeared unwilling to provide any additional information unless asked directly. For example, they did not let me know that tickets to the de Young Museum's exhibit was sold out when I specifically asked for directions and indicated that I needed to go purchase tickets; instead, I had to find out when I arrived at the de Young and was told that I could have pre-booked. In contrast, the concierge at the Four Seasons were more proactive. Room - stayed in a Grand Deluxe room and had a nice view of the city and the water. The room was very comfortable and large, similar in size to that of the Four Seasons. However, its furniture was showing some wear and tear with scratches evident. The closet was also smaller than those of the other hotels. The washroom had a great soaker tub that looked directly into the room, so you could have a view of the city. This was a nice feature that opened up the space and made it seem more spacious and bright. Plenty of towels that were nice and thick... I make a note of this because the towels at the Four Seasons should really be replaced. Extras - one small bottle of Evian was in the room during the day and another was provided at turndown. While a little more generous than the Four Season's one bottle at turndown, its still quite a bit more stingy than the Ritz Carlton. There is complimentary internet access provided through the business center - can't seem to recall if it's on the 2nd or 3rd floor - but you log in for 15 minute sessions with a countdown clock appearing at the bottom right hand side of your screen. You can extend the session, but you end up feeling rushed. Unlike the Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton, there was no morning coffee/tea service in the lobby. I believe it is located on the 4th floor where the hotel's restaurant, Vitrine, is located, but it is quite awkward to walk past the hostess in order to get coffee. The gym is quite nice, but is shared with the residences. A full range of equipment is available 24 hours a day, which is a nicer option than the Four Seasons (contracted through Sports Club/LA with limited hours) and the Ritz Carlton (located in the basement and is much smaller). Overall, it was a pleasant stay. I still prefer the Four Seasons for its rooms and overall service, but I had no major complaints with the St. Regis either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and City....”
Reviews.Author: KariD
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis SF was wonderful! The hotel's close location to the sfmoma was a plus. As other's stated, close walk to union square, etc.... Would stay again for sure. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Not your typical St. Regis but a beautiful taste of modern meets big city.

Reviews.Title: “Hooked up the dvd player”
Reviews.Author: jmtraveler92023
Reviews.Content: I really cant get down on any part of hospitality that goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable. I needed a DVD player for my son who was visiting me in the room and the front desk went a found one for me. Food is great and so is service. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel, Two Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: MierGen
Reviews.Content: My family had a total of four rooms, which I guess was a little too confusing for the staff as my two bags were sent to two of the other rooms, each on different floors. Fortunately my family had them so I didn't have to stress for long, but when the front desk called to ensure that I received my luggage and I told them "no", their only response was that they were very busy. I thought that at least an "I'm sorry about that" would have been nice. Or perhaps an offer to help me locate them. I was very disappointed in the attitude. The room itself was modern, roomy and comfortable, and the hotel is just a short cab ride from just about anywhere. The on-site restaurant was excellent, but my favorite part of the room was the wonderful steam shower. (My teenage daughter liked the bath tub in the middle of the room, where she could watch both the bedroom and the bathroom tv at the same time.) I'm glad I got to experience this gorgeous and trendy hotel once, but I don't think I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a long weekend. My wife and I are fans of more contemporary hotels and the St. Regis, although on the surface very much a business hotel, had all the services that we required from a long weekend stay. The bed was really comfortable and the tub was brilliant. The location of the hotel in SoMa was also great and allowed us to explore all of the artsy offerings of this area whilst still being very close to Union Square and the "touristy" bits. Everything about our stay was smooth and sleek and housekeeping was very thorough and we returned each evening with a great "wow" feeling when we entered our room. San Francisco in July can be cold and windy, and being able to return to the St Regis was always a pleasure! I would definitely recommend it to others who are looking for a large, modern hotel that caters well to both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not my favorite...”
Reviews.Author: TucHippo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis for three nights following a trip to Asia. I checked in fairly late (9 pm) so there was no problem getting a room. The hotel is quite modern but beautiful. My only other previous St. Regis experience had been at one in New York City; it is far more traditional in appearance and frankly, I found it much warmer with better service. The room was beautiful, with a nice view and great bath. The layout in the bedroom, with the hidden closet arrangement is different but nice, with ample space and lighting. The fitness area, shared apparently with the residences, was well equipped and very clean. The concierge was helpful and gave me a great recommendation for an Italian restaurant in the neighborhood. Overall a very nice hotel, but after the NYC St. Regis I was expecting just a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Mynameisdaisy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a fabulous long weekend at the St Regis recently. Our room was beautifully appointed and the high ceilings and giant windows gave it a real feeling of spaciousness. The staff were so helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The bed was wonderfully comfortable (perfect for a couple of jet lagged Australians). We spent a lovely couple of hours snuggled up in front of the fire place in the bar, enjoying the most terrific Pinot (recommended by our barman). Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but snooty staff”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a travel website since I had a $100 off any package coupon, and decided to splurge a bit on the St Regis to see what 5-star living was like. My friend and I checked into the hotel around noon, and were promptly given keys to the room. The hotel had placed us in a room with two double beds on the 11th floor, overlooking SFMoMA. We never heard or saw anyone else on the 11th floor, which was nice. The room was absolutely gorgeous. Our bathroom had a soaker tub, shower with a rainfall showerhead (which had fantastic water pressure), nice vanity area and separate toilet area. There were plenty of towels, and we were pleased to see bath sheet sized towels. The Remede toiletries smelled terrible, but maybe that's the norm for the brand. (I didn't care to smell like a pepperminty forest, so I didn't try them.) We LOVED the Pratesi linens on the bed, and the beds were fairly comfy. The turndown service was a nice touch. The room lacked a few little amenities. There's very little soundproofing in the bathroom, and I didn't really care to listen to my friend use the toilet. Though the room has a soaker tub, they don't offer any bubble bath to use. The toilet paper and tissues in the room were rough, 1 ply paper. I expected something a bit nicer! Here's what we didn't like: the hotel staff seemed to think that we were of a much lower class than their other guests. Granted, we came in dressed fairly casual but we certainly didn't look like street people! When we asked for directions to the local BART station, the concierge clerk seemed appalled. The hotel advertises that they will drop you off anywhere within a 3 mile radius in the hotel Bentley, but we were never offered a ride nor did ANY of the employees mention it. I find it crazy that the hotel charges for WiFi, although they did have a business center for guest use. Internet time in the business center was limited to 30 minutes, or so we were told. I liked the hotel, and would likely stay there again...provided that they treated me the same as any other guest staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: dollfingal22
Reviews.Content: We went for an anniversary stay when our favorite (the St. Francis on Union Square) was booked we were referred here. We were told it would be the ultimate in luxury and service. This hotel was GORGEOUS and the valet and bellmen could not have been more attentive and prompt. But we will NEVER stay here again. Here's why: We requested an early check-in so that we could freshen up from the car before seeing "Wicked". When my hubby called to confirm the reservation he was told that wasn't available (which was fine we know that's a perk that is rarely available in such a busy city) We arrived after our show at about 5:15. When checking in we were told our room was not yet available...WTF check in time is 3pm and it's 5:15 and our room isn't ready are you kidding me??? In our 10+ years of staying in 4 and 5 star hotels in SF this has NEVER EVER happened to us. We let the staff know that we had a dinner reservation we had to make and asked if a different room was available. They replied "sorry, no, we are fully committed" They would put a "rush" on the room and that they would be happy to get a few drinks for us in the bar while we waited. At 6:30 no one had come to tell us the room was ready so we went back to the front desk...where our keys were waiting in the Rolodex and the gentleman who had originally checked us in was MIA and we were helped by a young woman. HELLO!!! The guy knew we had a reservation to make and did not come get us when the room was ready! Soo basically, we paid for 21 hours in a hotel room and were already only receiving 18. We proceeded up to our room, they hotel itself was gorgeous. And as we opened the door we immediately realized why the room hadn't been ready...we were greeted by a room that had obviously been smoked in. It wreaked, it was disgusting. I called down to request a room change and was told that "they were fully committed " to which I answered "I'm not staying in this room" she said she would try to locate something (if you're full how are you going to locate something??) Like magic she called back within 5 min. and said that they had a cancellation for a room that was a step down from the room we were in. I said "fine" and then she asked "would you like to come down to get the keys?" HMMM....NO. You f*ed up, you bring the keys to me..talk about bad service! The second room we got into had no problems but the arrival experience had already left a bad taste in my mouth. I don't think I would have been so angry if they had just been more up front and honest with us about the room situation. Not to mention the fact that they tried to charge us the rate for the more expensive room we had booked and not the lesser room we ended up in. For the money we spent here I was shocked by the attention to detail or lack- there-of. A month ago we stayed at a Marriott for a wedding. We were informed on arrival that the room wasn't ready because someone had smoked in it and were immediately offered a different room (saving us the trouble of waiting for cleaning and moving rooms). Guess what...they also offered 50% off the rate without us even asking!! Now that is customer service. So...bottom line gorgeous hotel...top of the line luxery...service was aweful and not worth the $$, we will never stay again. oh did I mention the people in the room next to us were still partying at 3:30 am and after two calls to the front desk and a 45 min wait security finally came up and made them quiet down.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but service with a begrudging smile”
Reviews.Author: Baobab88
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes of this hotel, but came away with a mildly disappointing opinion versus our expectations for a St Regis. Rooms are perfectly fine, with all necessary amenities but given the price they charge one would think the least they could do was throw in internet? But no. We found that they managed to get many little things wrong: (i) played ping-pong with our food with room service (the staff were on the phone but clearly some communication issues internally) - took ages, order was wrong twice; (ii) after having asked reception for a 30 minute extension to checkout, I had housekeeping knocking on my door 3x to check when I was leaving - felt like they could not wait to kick us out; (iii) internet (as mentioned before); (iv) concierge, while clearly knowledgable, don't exactly give off the impression they are happy to be helping you; (v) we ended up having a noisy room where we could hear the street below us (from the 18th floor), we asked to be moved, and this was meet with an icy and curt 'no' from front desk - there wasn't even much effort to explore options. A stint at charm school would be quite useful for many of the guest-facing staff at this over-rated hotel. On the plus side, the fitness room is well-equipped, and the beds are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “I love the property and rooms..... I just wished the front desk staff matched the hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandiegojeffy
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for its nice rooms and class. However being a Starwood Platinum Guest I do expect a little extra care from the hotel. This stay when I asked for my upgrade "It was my moms birthday" they told me they where sold out so upgrades. But I went on there site after they told me this and they had for sale every room type possible. I was offended I was lied to so I called Starwood and they investigated. Long in short they made and excuse it was a computer error showing me the rooms. I decided to try them again because I love the property so much and I again am running into the same problems now they are trying to charge me up to 20,0000 points for the upgrade. And just simply read other reviews on here or on other sites and you will find they always upgrade platinum to metro suites. The place would be PERFECT if the staff matched the quality of the property. They have different excused for everything and it is never there fault. I told them last time I felt I was not wanted staying there. They told me that was not the case and told me they would upgrade me to the suite (that I should get in the first place). I thought in the least they may send some sort of apology or a little birthday gift for my mom just to actually make me feel like they cared but no. I will tell you that you will love your room but the staff is rather snooty.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: JMK1952
Reviews.Content: Returned today from our second stay at the St. Regis in San Francisco. We will return again one day. We enjoyed one evening in a suite this time. A lower floor so the view was nothing to rave about. The room was excellent though, and the bed and linen first class. Very comfortable. The hotel has a spa which was well appointed. I've been to nicer spas though. My masseuse had garlic breath, and that was no good! We went for a taxi to go out for dinner and the doorman offered the hotel's own car. That was nice and fun. The room service in the hotel was prompt and excellent. The hotel's only drawback, if there is one, is the hotel's location. It is not in Union Square, as some other posters have suggested, it is a few blocks away. I prefer a hotel on nob hill. I prefer an older hotel with character too, and the St. Regis is new and very modern. It lacks character. The room was ultra masculine too. Perhaps the decor could be softened up a bit to make it more homey. That being said, St. Regis is a great hotel. If you're visiting San Francisco, the St. Regis will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tucsondood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sophisticated and fit the mood of my trip perfectly. I spent an entire afternoon in the spa, ate in the restaurant, used the concierge service frequently, and I'm pretty sure all the room service waiters would remember me! My point is, I used it all and the staff never disappointed. Service is essential as is attention to detail, they excelled on all fronts. I usually always have SOME complaint, and this time...I just do not.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in SF at the moment”
Reviews.Author: teodam
Reviews.Content: Excellent, new, nice rooms. St regis contemporary is great. A little bit inferior compared to newest st regis hotel like singapore one, but still best hotel in san francisco. Rooms are great, and the asian restaurant is just great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful clean and modern feel.”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: Second time here and love the muted gray and white rooms. The room had a view of the financial district and loved soaking in my tub at night watching the lights of the city. The indoor swimming pool is a nice quite oasis after a busy day in San Francisco. I love the clean modern feel of this hotel; none of the stuffiness of a ritz or four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baci2003
Reviews.Content: We go to San Francisco every 2 years for a medical conference. We have tried 4-5 hotels different hotels close to the Moscone Center. The Saint Regis is by far the best. It is 1 block away. It opened just a few years ago so the rooms are luxurious and elegant. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was as big as an apartment on the 20th floor. The room was just fantastic. Great Service, Great Food and Great Location. I am definitely coming back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, modern elegance...but not at all stuffy”
Reviews.Author: PolkaDots
Reviews.Content: This was about my fourth stay at the St. Regis San Francisco. Each time I relax as soon as the car pulls up to the entry. There's something calming and reassuring about stepping foot into this hotel. I know the staff will be friendly and professional.The room...especially the tub...will make my visit comfortable and refreshing.Their new chef is a genius. He knows how to perk up a tired traveler's palate. I'll be back in a few months and hope to bring my husband. It will be a great romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern and Hip feeling”
Reviews.Author: odie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt very New Yorkish. There was an ultramodern bar and lobby that got quite busy on the weekend. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were dreamy. Large bathrooms were a plus with separate water closets. Turndown service was nice. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. The location is a bit off for many of the main areas. There is a fantastic restaurant directly across the street for breakfast and desert (other meals available but I didn't have them). I forget the name but it is directly across from the side entrance, right next door to Peets. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobMixson
Reviews.Content: beautiful city hotel. near convention center and shopping. wonderful concierge service

Reviews.Title: “School report: Must try harder.”
Reviews.Author: Jethrosdad
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great part of San Fran. But they cannot get the little things right. No promised newspaper. Lack of turndown service (despite a promise to return). Oh, and $15 a day for wifi!! At the prices they charge for a room. Outrageous. Enjoyed my stay tho'.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalikidd05
Reviews.Content: Good Business hotel. Rooms have high ceilings and feel spacious. Nicely decorated bar / lounge. Decent gym. However, the place somehow feels a bit cold and does not have much character. Probably caters more to business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Incredible. I got much needed rest.”
Reviews.Author: pviengmyxay
Reviews.Content: We live in the San Francisco Bay Area and didn't want to travel too far, as we only had one night away from being parents. So we opted to travel to San Francisco to spend the evening. The hotel is amazing and great locale. Room was a good size and I love how our bathroom opened up into the sleeping area. The shower-my spouse was speechless. He claims that was the best shower he's ever had! Pre dinner, we had drinks downstairs in the lounge area...pretty relaxed, trendy spot. If we didn't already have dinner plans with friends, I don't think we would have left the hotel. We felt like a million bucks after the spa, pool, fitness room and a good night sleep. The staff was great as well. I had forgotten my shampoo and conditioner, called the front desk for an extra bottle-they had housekeeping bring me a whole bag! Overall the stay was great and staff was very nice. I would definitely come stay here again. This is one of the best Starwood properties out there.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Stay”
Reviews.Author: AKCLondon
Reviews.Content: As a leisure traveller i would say this is more suited to corporate visitors. The staff were all excellent, professional and friendly. The fitness room and pool were top quality. Let done by no free WiFi ALso it was boring how they tried to push a $1200 Krug bath pamper experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury in SOMA”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingMoose
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis San Francisco is a sexy hotel....pricy, but sexy :b Everything about the hotel oozes modern luxury, and the service was top notch! Major props to the concierge who recommened phenomenal restaurants and cafes (...and not just recommened because of popularity!). The hotel may not be in Union Square, but it still felt centrally located to everything...Ferry Market Building, SF-MOMA, Union Square, China Town. The bar in the lobby is a poppin' spot on the weekends, so the lobby may feel like a club when coming back to your room late at night (noise was never an issue though). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! I am beginning to lovee the St Regis hotels more than the Four Seasons! But watch out! Very pricey! I got my partner a dozen roses and a bottle of chanpagne for his birthday and Valentine's day. The concierge set it all up - went very very smoothly and she made sure it all went off perfectly. But along with the champagne came a small bowl of strawberries (maybe 20 total?)... obviously, we enjoyed them - but when we chacked out, we saw they were $38! Seriously, $38 for a bowl of strawberries! They weren't even completely ripe! LOL... But that's expensive. Also, I ate a chocolate bar out of the mini-bar - $17! That aside... the hotel is gorgeous, the bar is super swank, the staff was amazing and it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: aniaolek
Reviews.Content: We spent the first couple of days of our honeymoon in the St. Regis Hotel in San Francisco and it was an amazing stay! The hotel is modern and luxurious, but what really put it over the top was the attentive staff who were very friendly and made us feel as if we were visiting friends or relatives. We were especially impressed by the concierge, who put a lot of effort into making sure that we get to do everything that we wanted in SF. All of the staff went out of their way to make sure that we feel special on our honeymoon. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and luxyrious!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes0008
Reviews.Content: Wou...we love this place the service was more than perfect, we loved having buttler service who unpacked for us and took care of all our need even bringing a little roap for our girl. we had a metropolitan suite corner unit in the 17 floor fenomenal view Location is great we walked and we took advantage of the choffer drop off service Breakfast was delicious...the best french toast ever!!! I will go back anytime loved the elegance of the atmosphere, every penny is worth it!!! Great experience

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary luxury in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: UpperWestSiderGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at this property, having stayed in their Astor Suite and Metropolitan Suite. Contemporary furnishings with ebonized wood floors. Luxurious cream marble baths, carpeted bedrooms, amazingly comfortable king beds. Solicitous and mannered staff, from greeters/valet at pullup in the rental car and thorough kind mannered and well trained front desk staff. Prompt service from room service, valet car pickup requests, and on premises restaurant, Ame. " Is there anything else I can do for sir ?" was a common question with each encounter with this hotel's staff. Stay here if you like contemporary furnishings, spectacular city views. Lobby bar and lounge is popular with locals and can get busy and noisy later in the evening. Well designed lobby and public areas, perhaps this property is not for you if you prefer traditional furnishings, though. I enjoy the complimentary coffee available in the mornings on the fourth floor by the casual restaurant and the large L shaped gym on 5. I did not use the 6th floor pool or spa, however. Prompt and thorough housekeeping staff and eager to please turn down service in the evenings, with every request met promptly and willingly. Museum of Modern Art is next door, and Metreon Center is across the street for films, Union Square and Market St. shopping just a few blocks away. My only negative observation is that the room/suite furnishings are looking slightly worn, some stains on the mohair sofa, and wood furniture looking very slightly scratched. Lovely thick towels, bathrobes, generous toiletries. Closet and drawer space is very limited however, a common design flaw among higher end contemporary hotels, I find. High speed elevators with rarely more than a few seconds wait. I love the motorized curtains and sun shades in the suite's bedrooms, although I must say the centralized touch screen telephone/command center can be frustrating and confusing to use unless you concentrate and look closely at the screen and it's functions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, no cellular reception”
Reviews.Author: citi10009
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is located pretty conveniently if you have business in downtown SF. The rooms are very new and well appointed. Staff is generally helpful, but service could be better. For example, when I called the front desk to ask about internet access, they informed me it would be extra, even though I could have sworn it was included in my rate (it was). A key issue is there is absolutely zero cellular reception if you're on AT&T. The hotel acknowledges this (obviously not their fault), so if you need blackberry access, forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Top rooms, Unobtrusive service”
Reviews.Author: xiphe
Reviews.Content: A more luxurious and relaxing room I have not stayed in. Excellent design offered great functionality. Interior design was decedent, with (faux) shagreen and leather covering the walls. Furniture was a little beat up, though...could have used a touch up here and there. Lipstick mark on the carpet was unsightly, as was greasy smear on the closet door. Mattress was very good, but not outstanding. Pratesi linens were nice, and bed was well made. Very minor negatives include somewhat low water pressure for the shower, increased noise on the Market St side of the hotel, and maid still making up the room at 3:30 pm despite our leaving the room before 11 am. Beautiful lobby and nice bar. Fitness area was a notch above, except treadmills were a little cheap/unstable. Room was ready at 1:30 at check in, and soon after arrival, manager offered us a nicely made little birthday cake for the occasion, which was a very thoughtful touch. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great room design - outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: LB8001
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the St. Regis for a long weekend in November 2009. The hotel was chosen by my excellent travel agent and she couldn't have done better. Every single person at the hotel, from the bell staff to the spa staff to the room service staff, was smiling, classy, helpful, fun, and just awesome. We each had corner rooms and the views were superb, the room design was very cool. The bar was hopping on Friday night and the design there also was very cool, and more great service. Location is great - you can walk everywhere and they'll take you to places you can't walk in the house car. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: drbroadway
Reviews.Content: We had first booked a night at the Palace. We had stayed at the palace seven years ago and remembered it being nice. Once we arrived we realized that they had not changed or cleaned a thing in the past seven years. So we moved to the St Regis. And although it costs a lot more, you get what you pay for. The staff greets you by name, the rooms are large, comfortable, well appointed, the bathroom is fantastic. The parking is a bit pricey ($50 for overnight), actually all of the extras are pricey but that's to be expected. All in all a great city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: tachikawasunshine
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, quiet, and had all the immenities needed to relax. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly, but not intrusive. Had breakfast delivered to the room and it was wonderful. It's a little on the expensive side, but I can't say that it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “My only complaint is the color of one wall”
Reviews.Author: Multi-Elite
Reviews.Content: I am known by family and friends as a very persnickety traveller. I can complain about having nothing to complain about. I usually stay in upper upscale hotels, and have high expectations for service and value. I had free weekend nights to burn and no time to head out of town, so I spent the weekend at the St. Regis. I loved every minute of it. I complained to my friends who were also staying at the hotel that the only thing I could complain about is how ugly the whitewashed oak wall was. The alarm clocks are futuristic, love the automatic blinds. An the turndown chocolate was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty better in SF”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: very average for 5* hotel, and for price of room - fairly new hotel - decor felt far more like a W than a St Regis, and not in a good way - check in fine, though a little slow - only 2 check-in desks, wouldn't like to see it when its busy (which it was, we were just lucky with timing) - told me my room would be ready in 5 minutes - then came back and said it would be three hours - i shudder to think what happened for it to be initially 5 minutes to 3 hours - i had a meeting anyway so wasn't that put out - room was very nice to be fair - big tv, comfy bed, very bright and airy, electric blinds etc - bathroom very plush, nice shower, big sunken tub check out painful - overcharged on a drinks bill, when i queried it said i'd have to wait as bar wasn't open yet (it was 11.30am and the bar IS the lobby effectively) - left with a bad taste - plenty more better chains and boutiques in the city

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel "special"? go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: toplesstaco
Reviews.Content: Very "special" feeling for close to $500.00 USD, per night. SPG a GREAT program..... NOT the St. Regis Lobby: Gas fireplace, smell overwhelming. Check in; NO Platinum amenity. NO information on city sights and sounds No SPG Platinum amenity Platinum guests discouraged! No late check out for Platinum members. Had to change plans because of that. EXTRA charge for newspaper Umbrella with Logo available...a great clue to all the undesirable bums/drug addict people out and about. Room; Dirty blanket......white dirt spots, on a very old blanket. Broken drawer thus closet door didn't close. No coffee maker Had to ask for slippers, should have been in room No iron and iron board Sleep impossible with bright clock, general electrical control Bathroom; Tub hot water on opposite side of "normal" for USA Bathroom toilet sliding door does NOT close tight Sink set back so far you MUST be tall to use it with out getting water all over. Maids; will MOVE everything turn down service, different each of our 3 nights, one with chocolate, another had to ask for and the third night late so I had to call down for service. Maids CLOSE room door...no one can see what they are doing inside your room. A plus, NO for they could be going thru everything! Hotel; Overall.......... staff ONLY appears to want the business suit and 5 carat diamond..........people. NO Jacuzzi available for two people of opposite sex. SMALL separate inside the spa, ONLY Positive; I had NOT paid costly rate per night, or I certainly would have gone elsewhere. Please see photos. Would I suggest this hotel to anyone? Not even if it were complimentary for they do NOT make you feel special!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: Great weekend stay with the family. Fantastic pool, super restaurant and excellent room. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quirdavi
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is my favourite hotel in San Francisco. The Rooms where 100% perfect and spotless. The staff were exceptionally helpful providing great information on car rental and restaurants. As we were attending a conference in the local conventions centre, this hotel was well placed for the 4 minute walk to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Surroundings, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis San Francisco is a fabulous hotel. It has absolutely everything you could want. It has elegant decor, attentive service (excluding final check-out), great food, a spacious swimming pool, gorgeous rooms, a central location, and a tranquil atmosphere. The claims made in previous reviews about a poor location are false. The hotel is only half a block from the SFMOMA, across the street from the Yerba Buena Gardens, a fifteen minute walk to The Embarcadero and the Ferry Building, and a five minute walk to Union Square Shopping. The claims of street-noise are also mostly false. The only noise we could hear was the sound emergency sirens, which we only heard during the day. Our first room was absolutely amazing. It was very spacious and well laid-out. It was very tastefully decorated in a scheme of creme, pale green, light blue, and light brown with chrome and wood accents. The beds were extremely comfortable and the art in the room was quite nice. The televisions were great and had many channels. The bathroom was ideal. It was enormous and had a large soaker bath, a stone tiled shower stall, and a separate lavatory. The vanity was very large with a nice sink and elegant fixtures. One of the other great features of the bathroom were the doors in front of the bathtub. They were nice because you could see out of the windows from the bath. From our room on the sixteenth floor, the view was very panoramic. We could see the Yerba Buena Gardens, the Bay Bridge, and many of the surrounding hills (as long as it is not incredibly foggy). The service was also amazing. Almost every single experience we had with the staff was great. The housekeeping staff is fabulous and the butlers were great. Though, the some greatest of all the staff were the Concierges. They were all amazing. The greatest were Caroline and Mariah. They were extremely helpful. Caroline booked tour reservations for us to go to Sausalito, the Muir Woods, and Wine Country. None of their dinner recommendations disappointed. They always sent confirmations of our bookings to our room and also gave us walking directions to all the restaurants. The pool at the St. Regis San Francisco is also great. It is very large and the space is very light, airy, and elegant. The food at the hotel was also phenomenal. We ordered from private-dining several times and both the quality of the food and the service were consistently fabulous. The only complaint was about the mysterious 21% "Service Charge" that was automatically added to each cheque. (We enquired about the charge over check-out and the employee at the desk rudely replied that "It is generally customary at four or five star hotels". If that is so, why have we not experienced a similar charge at the many other five star hotels we have stayed at!?! Other than the latter experience, I would highly recommend the St. Regis San Francisco to anyone looking for an amazing San Francisco luxury hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, chic contemporary design with push button lighting and blind controls. Bathrooms are the bomb with Remede amenities, though no mouthwash. No Platinum SPG amenity delivered to room. When I called and asked if they deliver one, they said depending on occupancy they'll take the time to bring some "sweets" to the room, but with high occupancy they do not. Requested a wine bucket, ice and four glasses. 25 minutes later as I was fuming, having called two more times for a total of three calls, it arrived. No suite upgrade for Platinum SPG. They claimed they did not have any Astor suites available, so I fired up the laptop and told them they might want to take a look at the online website. They upgraded us to a corner room, but not without some major verbage on my part and only on the second day of our stay. Let's be frank, if you have Platinum SPG guests it's probably not going to create a good image of the management of this hotel for the front desk employees to get caught lying about whether or not upgraded rooms are available. No Club floor. For those who think this hotel is the "best" in San Fran, I suggest they try out a competitor a block away or the two well known hotels on Nob Hill that do have Club Floors. The style is different on Nob Hill but no comparison in service. We had friends come in to pick us up so they could see the room. Oops, first 30 minutes at the St Regis is a mere $10! The valet had been told they would be up and back down, but yet they did not leave the car up, even though they weren't busy. Down it went into the garage and we waited for 20 minutes while they retrieved the damn thing. I finally had a come to Jesus meeting with one of the guys and the car magically appeared. Overnight parking is a veritable bargain at $50. And if you're silly enough to use the hotel laundry service then you deserve the surprise you'll get with those charges. We dropped a pair of pants at a nearby cleaners for same day service with a wine spot from lunch rather than auctioning off our first born to pay for "rush" laundry with the hotel. AME is a fine restaurant. I'm not sure where the Michelin star fits in, but it's quite good and as pricey as any of the high end restaurants it competes against, but not overly so. Breakfast on the other hand looks to be outrageously priced. No buffet, and the room service prices will really get your attention. The gym is somewhat small and the weight equipment is packed in. Plenty of good cardio equipment and an attendant during daytime hours with cold water, towels and fruit. We've been in larger more spacious gyms, but there's nothing wrong with this. No iron or ironing board in the rooms. You have to call the Butler or Front desk. Each time we called, regardless of the reason or occasion the phone rang off the hook before being answered. Lord knows why, but in a hotel that wants to charge $350 and up per night, at least staff the phones appropriately. Once we got through the iron was delivered within 5 minutes, but no ironing board, but she quickly retrieved it and brought that once she realized we wanted an ironing board also. Acceptable flat screen tv plus one in the bathroom, which is really a very nice upscale touch, with a very good assortment of channels to select from. Also the robes and towels are excellent as one would expect in a 5 star hotel. Tub and shower. Location is next to SF Museum of Modern Art, other than that, if you don't have reason to be south of Market, the location won't do much for you. Thankfully, San Francisco is compact so most places in the city are within a short cab ride. Of the 5 star hotels I have stayed, this has the bones, but clearly I thought the service did not justify their pricing. If one has never experienced a hotel of this caliber I guess you could get all googly eyed at the glamour, the design, the lovely lobby/bar and the HOPPING bar scene on weekends with 20 and 30 year olds cocktailing until the wee hours, but it was lacking to us. Maybe the fact that we weren't even acknowledged as Platinum guests when checking in, no Platinum amenity, having to argue with the front desk or whether there were upgraded rooms, just left a weird feeling. We would not stay again unless it were in the low $200's. It doesn't merit anymore in our opinion. Now if we were on an expense account and could care less what our boss thought, then maybe we'd do it, but I'd sooner blow the corporate card on the 5 star a block away or up on Nob Hill. Those are far more of a value than the St Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Fran Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: mazie164
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel and the best hotel I have ever stayed in while in San Fran, maybe the best hotel ever! The staff is very attentive and the rooms are gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: rxdxt
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Great style, amazing concierges (they even tolerated my switching restaurants twice!). Good gym.. my only, and really it's more of a winge than a proper complaint, is that there isn't free/normal price overnight laundry/Drycleaning like at the four seasons - a necessity for a road warrior like me. However, compared to the dreary Four Seasons (which is from the stone ages apparently - this hotel is fantastic. Highly Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL BUT... POOR SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: xbessard
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, well located but there is NO service. Room was not ready when we arrived. We had to wait and to pay for a coffee! No coffee / tea machine in the room. No special amenities for PLATINUM SPG (no special SPG desk for the check in or the check out). The Concierge is totally NUL!!! Very noisy lobby. Expensive breakfasf (no buffet)...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherOntarioguy
Reviews.Content: Check-in was great. Stephen made sure we were aware of all the facilities and had our bags delivered within minutes. We were apparently upgraded and the room was very spacious and chic. Close to the MOMA as well as plenty of upscale (and downmarket) shopping. By the bed is an LCD touchscreen unit that controls the A/C, Lighting, Curtains, Phone and Radio. The king bed was very comfortable. Despite being on the 19th floor some street noise intruded. Good sized flat screen tv in the bedroom and a smaller one in the bathroom. Large deep tub and large separate shower stall with waterfall shower head. Nice big fluffy towels and dressing gown. Slippers too. The Fitness Center is well equiped and the Pool is great for laps. Internet was fast although I am always annoyed at the extra charge for it in higher end hotels. $14.95 here. Housekeeping was very efficient. Nightly turndown included evian water. Free coffee or tea in the morning in the 4th floor restaurant. Oh yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: Always my top choice in San Francisco, the St. Regis leaves no stone unturned. The decor is high-end and stylish, but understated â€“ not ostentatious. The service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avcask23
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Very chic. And the service level is what you would expect from a 5 star establishment. Location is central as it is only three blocks from union square and one from market street. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Needs to Improve Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one night on a busy weekend in June. Check-in is smooth. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that my room has been upgraded to the Corner room on the 19th Floor. The view of the park is very nice and the room is very spacious. Room: A/C, Light, Curtain all within a touch of a button. Comfortable St.Regis Bed. Thick walls/good sound proof so I can have a good night sleep. There's a small TV in the bathroom too so you can enjoy watching tv while taking a bath. Adequate lighting so you can adjust it to the way you want to be. Bathroom: Separate Shower/Tub. There's a rainforest style shower but it is a bit weak for my taste. However, it is still very nice for US hotel standard. Fitness Center: Complete gym with assistant available between certain hours. The Hotel's pool adjacent to the Remede spa is very, very nice. You can order room service and eat over there if you want. Service: Most items bought up within minutes. Concierge was very helpful in terms of providing directions. One thing I have to mention here is that on the day that I am checking out, the housekeeping lady opened my door without even knock (nor the Do Not Disturb Sign) at 11am despite I had the checkout at 4pm. I should've deadlocked the door but still, with the hotel thats 5*? This should not be happened here and I have called frontdesk in regards to this issue prior to check out and they just said "We will follow up on it, then hung up, seems like they were in a hurry). I have still not hear a word back as of now. Despite the service issue, I will return to this property and I will update my review once I have received the contact from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the San Regis for business. The facility is really well kept & the room I had was beautiful - very modern with wood, glass in grey & beige shades. The bathroom is gorgeous. The only negative feeling was at the front desk on arrival when the Receptionnist told me to wait without greeting me first & not even looing up at me. Apart from this, service was impeccable. Overall, for a Starwood chain hotel, I would say it is a highly desirable place to stay at in SF.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here until the end of time.”
Reviews.Author: HotelHeroine
Reviews.Content: Beautiful huge room. Free bottle of champagne because it was Valentine's Day. Friendly waiter who brought our champagne poolside (with plastic cups since there's no glasses allowed by the pool). BEAUTIFUL bathtub, shower and bathroom. All light, curtain, TV controls on the phone display screen. Gorgeous view of San Francisco at sunset. Great bar to catch up with friends. Yummy restaurant- AME. Amazing spa with a nice pool, sauna, steam, jacuzzi, great services, MORE CHAMPAGNE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveg69
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to SF i opted for a 3 nite stay at the St Regis (Fri/sat/sun). I think my overall comment "Nice Hotel" sums up the experience perfectly. It wasn't "Wow/fantastic got to go back but it wasnt "Avoid at all cost." The Hotel entrance/Bar is lovely, very trendy, modern and first impressions are excellent. We received a speedy check-in and a porter escorted us to our Metropolitan Suite on floor 10. The suite was nice , very spacious, trendy, comfy bed, large shower, lots of gadgets electric blinds etc...There were a few wear & tear marks on the furniture but no major complaints. The hotel was probably regretting the cream carpet they had laid throughout the hotel room floors as it was looking dirty and well worn and let the rest of the hotel down. I agree with some comments regarding street noise but it wasnt all nite just on the odd occasion. I found all the staff really nice from the Doormen , porters, cleaners etc... Breakfast in the Vitrine restaurant was very nice (a little expensive), and the staff were always friendly and effecient. Overall i would recommend this hotel however it was my first visit to SF so i have no previous SF hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mousseChicago
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 4 nights with 2 separate visits. Rooms are modern. Deluxe King was roomy enough. Liked the tub between the room and sink area. What I didn't like was the pocket door that doesn't quite shut all the way for the toilet/shower area. The rest of the bathroom is optionally open to the room. I, like many women, prefer privacy. Only big negative on the room. The check-in staff on the first visit as well as the reservations person were not welcoming or friendly. The rest of the staff on the visit (doormen, porters,other check-in, concierges) were very nice. Steven, a concierge,seemed pretty clueless about what makes a good concierge, however. Anyone can use opentable.com but that was his solution to anyone that needed restaurant reservations. He had no relationships/connections with other establishments for when a colleague requested help with a special request. Manuel,at the front desk, was absolutely great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: JD1946
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here and found it to be a quality property. We were given an 18th floor corner room - great views. I do not understand some of the previous reviews regarding street and local bar noises - As far as I could observe there are absolutely no bars or cocktail lounges around this hotel. I did not detect any street noise - but since I live in downtown San Diego maybe I'm just used to the urban environment. Room service was quick and efficient. The lobby bar was quite busy - but pricey. We never experienced either of the two restaurants or the spa. The St. Regis is well located, just south of Market Street, a short walk to Union Square and numerous very good restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Madison90
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the St. Regis and was again impressed withthe staff and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cut backs in service taking their toll”
Reviews.Author: Asiavistor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis for the first time and was completely shocked by the service quality and rooms. For the price I would have expected the rooms to be perfect and the service to be flawless but in reality neither the rooms or service met expectations. I asked a member of the hotel staff what was occurring that could impact the hotel and he mentioned that the hotel was cutting hours due to the current economic environment. Next time I will stay in the FOur Seasons as I hear the service is still quality. This hotel seems to be in a bit of a death spiral as the rooms are not full, service is being cut as a result and guests are now going else where which will most likely result in further cuts to services.

Reviews.Title: “Design over Comfort”
Reviews.Author: SBCCA
Reviews.Content: Pleasant registration....upgrade to Lady Astor Suite and early check-in (platinum member). Suite is elegant and minimalist: large sitting area with just a sofa and small coffee table, side table and one lamp. Looks great in the daytime, but the one small lamp is so weak that you can't read anywhere in the room at night. Couldn't even eat rooms service breakfast in sitting area in the morning because it was too dark. Only hotel I've stayed in where there is no notepad and pen or pencil by the phones. More minimalism? Only stationery was one note card and one envelope. Had to use them for making notes by the phone. Two nice, big plasma HD TVs, but none of the channels are in HD. (Lowly Sheraton at SFO has HD channels!) Room service continental breakfast cost $30, but pastries didn't taste freshly baked. Called to have them pick up the tray. After 20 minutes, I needed to take a shower so put the tray outside the door. When I checked out an hour later the tray was still there. (Minimalist room service?) Twelve-foot ceilings in sitting area and by desk are nice, but nearly impossible to open and close curtains completely using long, long plastic wands to move heavy curtains. Ended up getting behind sofa and pulling them aside hand over hand. (Minimalist curtain controls?) Shades in bedroom were, thankfully, motorized. Butler service also minimalized. Never saw one. I've stayed at five other St. Regis Hotels and always had a butler show up during or just after moving in to describe services and explain room equipment. No coffee/tea maker in room. Assumed that just having a cup of coffee would incur room service charges. Broadband is fast. ($14.95/day charge) and room was very clean. The suite looks like something out of "Architecture Digest," but it's better seen in a magazine. Next time in SF, I'll book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome oasis after a day of travelling. The lobby/bar area is tasteful, dramatic and very welcoming, it really made me feel like I was entering a beautiful hotel. I was not disappointed with the room either. It was a spacious and well appointed, with a modern clean design, and the view was amazing. I liked that there was a deep window ledge at the window to allow you to sit and enjoy the view. The bed was big, soft and comfy. The bathroom was also big with the toilet and the shower each in their own minirooms off the main bathroom. The wall on the side of the tub was actually doors that could open into the main bedroom, allowing you to lounge in the bed and see the view or the TV, and essentially still be in the main room. Everything in the room is controlled by a touch screen device next to the bed, including the lights, and the drapes, which open and close at the touch of the screen. The location of the hotel was great, literally next door to the SF Museum of Modern Art, and right around the corner from all the great shopping in Union Square. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff but Issue with Room”
Reviews.Author: Audrey'sAuntie
Reviews.Content: We were 1st time visitors to SF so the location to the hotel was great, close to Union Square right off Market St. The hotel staff was incredible! So professional! Their service was exceptional and attention to detail was impeccable, so please know that the SMALL & BIG issue I had with our room had nothing to do with the amazing staff at the hotel. THE SMALLER ISSUE: We booked the Astor Suite, which was a really good size room with a fantastic view, but tell-tale signs of looking "worn" for the $price of the room. It was kind of like "The Hotel" at Mandalay Bay, starts out with amazing interior design and modern decor, but then eventually depending on the clientele you get, starts to look worn sooner than later. (Scuffed up coffee table, furniture legs, worn carpeting etc) You expect that with Vegas, I didn't expect that with the St. Regis in SF. THE BIG ISSUE: We happened to be staying on a Fri & Sat night on the 10th Fl, what we didn't know was that there was a raging night club 10 floors below our window. After a full day of exhaustive sightseeing, thumping music, horn-honking and drunken fights kept us up until 2AM!! (White/traffic noise we can handle, we used to live in NYC, but this was so aggravating!) We had to wait until the night club closed to go to sleep. I TRULY APPRECIATED the hotel management's attempt to make it up to us by moving us to a grand suite the following night, but it wasn't worth losing a night's sleep over and having to pack up all our suitcases to change rooms. As much as I loved the staff, this might be the reason we book somewhere else the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed five days while on business in San Francisco. Was upgraded to a corner room. Pros: high tech room-very cool touch screen room controls exceptionally clean room excellent amenities and products in the washroom excellent housekeeping and turndown service great food in room service and excellent service however never order their pizza...it was awful great concierge service fantastic bar with great service and food selection spa was very nice as you get free champagne and chocolate truffles Cons: Internet access was expensive for my stay They charged me a handling fee for receiving a package sent to the hotel Spa products were over priced As you can see my pros outweigh the cons and I would definetely stay here again.In fact from being a loyal Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton guest I think I may stay only at the St. Regis Hotels and Resorts from now on as long as they have one in the location I will be staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Quality”
Reviews.Author: lennydj
Reviews.Content: Unlike most hotels in the St Regis chain ,this is extremely good . The service is supreme . The rooms are clean ,spacious ,great views .The beds comfortable . There is however one let down : The resturant for breakfast is nothing less than a disaster and highly priced ,with almost humorous service , in fact you could re make Faulty Towers here . The biggest plus for this hotel are the Concierges ,normally in my experience snobby,uncreative at best ; here at the St Regis truly great , helpfull and best of all knowlegable . The St Regis is probably the best Hotel in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Space - Getting Better but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: 5starlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed three times in 2008. From the street the first floor is beautiful. The street itself is a little dark and could use some exterior light. The lobby bar is sophisticated. The front desk area is a little small and quite noisy when the bar is lively. Service at the front desk was good, though a little robotic. Sometimes the butler escort is pleasant, sometimes awkward. The best service is at the Concierge desk. Robert is a city expert who wowed me with his knowledge and care. The hotel is both modern and comfortable. The hallways look fantastic. The carpet and colors are quite seductive. All rooms seem to be convenient to the elevators. Rooms are great! Great size for sf hotel rooms. The electronic features of the room seem great but didn't always work. Bathrooms are big. I thought I liked the bathtub that opened to the bedroom but having a room without that feature was better. The best room I had had double beds and a gigantic bathroom. I would prefer different bath products than the Remede line they provide. The chaise lounge does not provide much of a seating area and ends up being a place to throw bags and clothes. A comfortable chair to sit in and put your feet up would be wonderful. The closet is too small and in an awkward location. Views are good. My favorite overlook Yerb Buena Park looking west toward the hills. Room service is good. Food is better than the service. Housekeeping is great. Fitness center is small, too small for a luxury hotel. Pool and spa are great though some of the spa features (sauna, hot tub) close too early. Food at Ame is fantastic though the dining room is rather drab. I would stay here over the other 5 star properties in the City. I'm hoping more room extras are offered in the future to make me feel special when I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking hotel in the most beautiful city in the USA”
Reviews.Author: GXS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis October 30th for 3 nights and had a wonderful time there. The St. Regis is a breathtaking hotel providing a relaxing experience. Youâ€™ll know youâ€™re at a 5 star hotel. I've included some pictures so check them out as well. On our way to the St. Regis we actually drove past the hotel the first time since you enter the hotel through a side street and not directly from 3rd Street. As we entered the hotel we noticed that the main entrance/lobby/bar had breathtaking floor to ceiling glass windows. The decor was very modern and had an upscale feel. We were escorted to the front desk where we were quickly checked in. The man who helped us told us we would get connecting rooms since we had reserved 2 rooms. Additionally, one room had been upgraded to an Executive Premier room (a corner room). I couldn't wait to see the corner room. After check-in we were escorted to the elevators. Our rooms were located on the 9th floor. The first (smaller) room had 2 queen beds and had views of the Yerba Buena Gardens, Metreon, St. Patrick's Church, and the city. The materials, detail, and quality of the room was amazing. The decor is very modern, warm, and relaxing. The wall against the beds are lined with stitched leather panels, the wall/cabinet doors opposite the beds are made from Mozambique wood, and natural stone is used throughout the bathroom. The best feature of the bathroom is the rain shower. I could take a shower all day long. The second room, the corner room (Executive Premier room), was about 20% larger and had a king bed instead. The room had the same design theme and materials as the first room. The bathroom layout was about the same with the exception of it being just a little bit smaller. The view from the room was also the same as our first room with the exception of the corner that had floor to ceiling glass windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the Yerba Buena Gardens and the surrounding area. Lighting, temperature, clock, alarm, phone, hotel services, etc for both rooms were controlled by a touch pad beside the bed. Very convenient to control everything from one point. Like other high end hotels umbrellas were provided in the room which came in very handy since we had rainy weather during our whole stay. Additionally, the rooms had DVD players in case you are in the mood for watching DVDâ€™s. Service throughout the hotel was excellent. If we called housekeeping for something it was brought up to us in no time. Staff throughout the hotel was always courteous and they never used the word "no." The guys from the valet were always helpful and courteous. We had breakfast in Vitrine (restaurant in the hotel) every morning. The food and service was very good.
