Their banana pancakes are to die for. We also had dinner at Ame (another restaurant in the hotel) which has an Asian influenced menu. We were seated at the "red table," a big red table supposedly created by the restaurateurs. I thought the lighting wasnâ€™t very good. There were too many dark spots throughout the restaurant. The food however was different and very good. All in all we had an amazing and problem free stay at the St. Regis and will definitely stay there again when we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Passes more as a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqBusTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was OK. I was upgraded to a Metropolitan Suite after a disasterious booking bungle by the booking website I used, which the hotel thankfully corrected. The suite was well appointed with 2 TV's / DVD players, printer / scanner / fax machine, comfortable bed and wonderful bathroom. Room service was fantastic! Friendly waiters, delicious food and efficient service. Unfortunately, the hotel falls down in other service areas. The staff in the "spa area" were unhelful and rude, as was the dismissive reception manager who did not wish to resolve my booking problem. As a whole, the hotel unfortunately does not live up to the 5 star criteria in my eyes, as I didn't always feel welcome and everything always seemed like such a hassle for the staff. This is a typical Starwood / Westin chain hotel, displaying the same problems I have found at their other properties in Cape Town and Singapore: staff training!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful five night stay in a Metropolitan Suite. The suite offered plenty of room. We hosted a cocktail party for fifteen one evening and everyone had plenty of room to relax. The blackout shades in the room were very nice. I loved the control panel that operated the shades, lights, etc. I also loved the little sitting area in the hall between the bedroom and bathroom-it had the a perfect little area putting on makeup and fixing my hair. The hotel was in easy walking distance to all of the beautiful city. My friends' had a deluxe room and it did have a better shower-walk in with room for about six! I had other friends staying at the W and while their room was nice, the property was a bit vibrant for my taste. The staff at the St. Regis were helpful and kind. They made last minute dinner reservations for me and were very helpful in the planning of my cocktail party. I left behind items in a drawer and they FedExed them right out to me. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Next to Museum of Modern Art”
Reviews.Author: 2darlingbuds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days/two nights at this modern hotel located on 3rd Street and Mission in downtown San Francisco. Next door is the acclaimed Museum of Modern Art and a block away from the Moscone Center, Jewish Contemporary Museum and near the shopping arcade. My husband booked our reservations over the phone and reserved a corner suite to celebrate our anniversary and his birthday. Upon arrival, the doormen were friendly and assisted with our bags, and the front desk person was equally welcoming -- she even offered a late check out of 4pm (helped that we were Starwood members). The hotel does have a private car to take you to where your excursions or reservations are located, but this may take 15-30 minutes of waiting time since the car(s) is/are available on a first come/first serve basis (plan to call ahead at least 30 min. before you need to leave NOT when your reservation is). Also, the hotel car can not pick you up and bring you back to the hotel, so plan on alternate transportations. The room was on the corner along Mission, which we found to be very noisy with sirens and loud talking/yelling from the streets below. A good tip would be to request a corner room facing a non-busy thoroughfare. The furnishings and ammenities were comfy -- an L-shaped sofa in the livingroom, desk, king bed, electronic motorized window shades (both black out and sheer), flat screen consoles in livingroom and bathroom. The plus side: sleek and modern furnishings on a quite floor. The minus side: noisy corner location and not enough face towels. We had drinks at the bar downstairs and enjoyed the low-lit and holiday decorated ambiance -- a nice relaxing way to spend the time after a day of hustle and bustle!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Modern Elegance”
Reviews.Author: EliteTraveler1A
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis, San Francisco is a wonderful modern addition to San Francisco's hotel offerings. The staff is very friendly and the butlers go out of their way to help you enjoy your stay. On one occasion, the butler knew we were going out for a day of walking/shopping and we returned to find juices/waters/ my shoes filled with shoehorns and a very kind note from him waiting in our room. A great location and excellent furnishings/amenities. The touchscreen smart home automation in all the rooms is a nice touch, as are the wonderful spa-like bathrooms. Overall, a great stay and a wonderfully elegant and modern hotel. Having booked through the American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts Program, all the included amenities were great. Room: We stayed in a Metropolitan Suite. The corner room was modern and spacious. Furnishings were great as were the views A spacious dining table, entertainment system, and great sofa area all make this the perfect choice for a comfortable stay or to entertain and have pre-dinner drinks. The bathroom was superb and spa-like - only wish the shower had multiple showerheads/body sprays. Restaurant: Breakfast at the Vitrine Restaurant was excellent and the china/linens are highly luxurious. Wish we tried the lobby-level Ame restaurant, but did not have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Not Sure if I'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: XComsGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first weekend in November at the St. Regis Hotel. We live in the East Bay, but have only been in the area for a year and have yet to see the sights. So we chose this weekend to catch Jim Gaffigan's performance and visit Alcatraz. We checked in about 6pm. The people at the front desk were very nice, and we were escorted to our room by one of the men who works there. He smiled the whole time, and was a bit pushy when it came to carrying our bags. He would not take my husband's no as an answer. Once at our room, he showed us the electronic system they have set up, and finally left. I'm the kind of person who likes to be left alone to figure things out for myself, so I didn't really enjoy this part of the hotel stay. The hotel room was beautiful. They have a deep soaking bathtub that can fit 2 people in it. The bathtub has doors next to it that open into the bedroom. This was kind of cool. There's also a t.v. in the bathroom. The only drawback about the bathroom was that the toilet and shower were cornered into their own little room, but the door that slides to close-off the these things from the rest of the bathroom leaves a little crack, so if I'm in the bedroom and the doors next to the tub are open, I can see my husband using the toilet. This disturbed him to no end, but it is easily solved by closing all of the bathroom doors. Also, on our first night, we decided to run a bath. The water was very dirty, which we deduced was from an incomplete washing of the tub. After we washed it with a facecloth, the tub was fine. Another drawback was the electronic screen that controlled everything. When we used it to turn off all of the lights in the room, we would awake in the middle of the night to lights turning themselves on. So if you do stay here, turn off the lights manually. It's really annoying to wake up multiple times during the night to lights. This happened on both nights of our stay. We ate breakfast at the Vitrine on Saturday. I got the french toast which was very good. My husband got eggs benedict. He didn't like the food, but that's more his fault than theirs. He had never had it before. Overall the service in the restaurant was good, and the food was very good. The only thing I must complain about is the staff's disrespect for privacy. My husband and I have stayed in many hotels, fancy and not. We expect more from hotels that we pay more for, but unfortunately that is where we get the least. This hotel has an electronic "Do Not Disturb" and "Make Up Room". We value our privacy a lot, so for every hotel we stay at, the "Do Not Disturb" goes up as soon as we enter and comes down when we leave (it does not come off any time in between). For all of the other hotels we've stayed in with the exception of The Palace in NYC, our "Do Not Disturb" has been honored. However, it was completely disregarded. Before leaving for Alcatraz, I made sure the "Do Not Disturb" was on. When we got back a few hours later, it was off and our room had been cleaned. When we approached Ron at the front desk, he apologized "sincerely", said he would report the incident, and offered nothing. Once I got tired to the whole thing and left my husband to argue, Ron offered us free breakfast or a reimbursement for the night's stay we would not be using if we chose to leave at that moment. Needless to say, a $50 breakfast is nothing compared to the $580/night I was paying to stay there... ...We had to speak to 3 different people before they would finally offer us a free night (and that only because we had to ask for it). After Ron, we spoke to Craig (the non manager, I don't remember his last name). He spoke to some woman in charge of hospitality and offered us a 50% reduced rate if we stayed. Finally, we spoke to Craig Chang (the front desk manager) who offered us the night for free. He even sent us a hand-written note apologizing for everything, and left a note at the front desk confirming that the night was free. If it had not been for him, this hotel would receive a star of "1" and we would never go back. I have not decided if we will ever stay here again. The room was great, and for the most part so was the service. Just make sure if you ever stay here and there is a problem that you ask for Craig Chang ASAP. Some other good things about the hotel is they have a 24 hour pool and 24 hour room service. We unfortunately did not take advantage of either of these things, but it's nice to have them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property & Great restaurant, but service off & $15 for internet”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a good location, directly next to the Moscone convention center and 5 minutes walk from Union Square and all the shopping. The rooms are great - large, contemporary and well equipped, and the pool was good too and always emtpy. The food in Ame on the ground floor was excellent. A great if expensive dinner with friends and good Asian Californian fusion cooking. The bad - I was really surprised to find that generally, with the exception of the Ame restaurant, the staff could not really care less about guests and were quite aloof, just going through the process and almost as if they didn't want to be there, which was a shock in a property like this. On business, I also object to the $15 for 24 hours internet access charge - why do properties do this ?? Finally, breakfast is also not worth it and too expensive. Its too weird for me having fusion cooking first thing in the morning. (This in the upstairs restaurant). On balance though, location, room quality and comfort made it a good stay. For the price though, they need to sort the service / welcome aspect of the stay and throw in the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Stay At St. Regis San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ikpa
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room was ice cold. The air conditioning unit had malfunctioned. After about an hour we called for the unit to be repaired. Thinking it was fixed we left the room only to return to an airconditioning unit that was still broken, this time the room was warm and stuffy. At 4AM not being able to bear it nor sleep we called to be switched to another room, a very difficult proposition as there was a general reluctance to do so on the part of the hotel. We insisted, they came up with a security detail. This I believe fed into the general misconception that a black man could be a person of violent disposition. Could it be racial profiling as I have an accent and happen to be black? Needless to say the hotel refused by delay tactics to send someone over to move our luggage to the new room. After waiting for half an hour it dawned on us they were not going to help us move. We did it ourselves. The hotel went further to delay making our room until at 4:30PM when we returned to the room and insisted that it be made. Overall, a very shabby treatment for the money we paid to stay in the hotel. A shirt sent out to be ironed came back late, causing us to almost miss our appointment. I could not be paid enough to stay here another day!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without the attitude! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the St. Regis with a friend of mine for a 4 day weekend. We found the hotel to be excellent across the board. Rooms are light and airy, well appointed with many conveniences and the blackout shades really do BLACK out completely as needed. I loved the configuration of the room with the double doors over the bath that open to the living area - made the room seem much larger. We used many of the hotels services - early checkin, and I mean really early. We arrived by 11am and were promptly given a room, no issues Spa - pedi and massages, all were excellent Pool/jacuzzi/sauna - all clean and uncrowded Butler - Prompt and helpful Concierge - got us reservations at my favorite restaurant which was 'booked solid' when I tried to call Room service - great food delivered to the minute at 7am on the day of our departure. All in all - I loved the St. Regis - it was a perfect backdrop for a great weekend in SF. And did I mentioned it's located about 2 blocks from teh Powell BART/Trolley station? So easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort in every detail”
Reviews.Author: Jenikaye
Reviews.Content: We caught an earlier plane than planned and so arrived early, but we were ushered immediately into a beautiful, soothing room of sage and cream with a huge tub and beautiful view of San Francisco. The concierge was helpful, the butler was top-notch, too. We joked that elves cleaned our room every time we stepped out of it; they even left us a divine chocolate bar that came in handy when we were starving. We made appointments at the spa, and it was the epitome of luxury for us to be pampered so well. I had my eyebrows done and a massage; both were delightful and so relaxing, and we swam in the beautiful pool, too. At one point in our trip, we had gone to a concert and returned, stopping at the bar for a drink. My friend left her backpack on a chair when we got up to leave, and as we were rushing out the door, a St. Regis employee came after us to say we'd forgotten our bag. I asked her to hold it there for us, and they did; we had many valuables in that bag, and they took care of it. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimplesthechupacabra
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing short of amazing. The lobby is beautifully modern. Very spacious and comfortable. The location is ideal. It's just next to MOMA, literally right next door. It's one street over from Market street near Union square shopping, which is amazing of course. A walk down towards Embarcadero is also not far. The ferry building is only about a half mile. Such a great location for so many things. The standard room is so comfortable. The linens have wonderful thread count and very comfy. Amazing rain head shower. The room control system is state of the art. It controls everything in your room and doubles as a private line phone. electronic black out and roman shades were part of the room ammenities. i cannot recommend them highly enough. i can't wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for a good night sleep - stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: nini38
Reviews.Content: While I would agree with others that this is a unique place to stay. I have to admit I was disappointed in my overall experience. The room - we upgraded to a jr. suite. We are SPG members & took advantage of the 50% rate - perhaps that was the problem? We were put in room 1311 - beware of the "11" rooms. Initially it looked great, but upon closer inspection, it was in need of maintenance. The "11" rooms are corner rooms and were extremely noisy. I swear it was as if the windows were single pane. From the 13th floor, we could hear a woman talking loudly on the street! St. Regis is just down the street from the fire station and there were sirens all thru the night. There was also construction across the street that started at 6:30 am. If you are looking for a good night sleep - you are not going to get it on this side of the hotel! The furniture throughout the rooms was all nicked up. - see the pictures! The corners of the walls had chunks out of them and had not been repaired. The sliding doors were all nicked up. Their fancy computerized lighting system kept re-setting itself in the middle of the night - loud enough to wake me up. The do not disturb (digital) sign would only stay on for a few minutes and them automatically turn itself off. Since it wouldn't stay on, the maid kept knocking on the door in the morning. The shower is really small, hardly any closet space, hardly any space on the bath vanity. On the positive side, the tv's were nice and the bed was comfortable. They did give us a bottle of champagne and chocolate for our anniversary. The advantages of having a ride 5 min. ride in the house BMW or Bentley just don't make up for the lack of sleep. Next time I will stay elsewhere. The thousand dollars or so that I save by staying elsewhere can help pay for the use of a town car service :-)

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco St. Regis is Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: curly-Q28
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor, most confortable bed ever!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Contemporary Feel, Impeccable Staff”
Reviews.Author: froggydog
Reviews.Content: We were married at the St. Regis San Francisco in Summer 2006 so this hotel holds a special place in our hearts. We stayed in one of the property's "St. Regis Suites" (the suite level just below the Presidential), though we had occasion to see just about every room configuration in the hotel (from the rack rooms, to the Astor Jr. Suites, to the larger Metropolitan suites). Each room is beautifully decorated. One nice touch is a touchscreen device that acts as both the telephone as well as a control panel for lowering lights and window shades. The design aesthetic is contemporary, clean, and thoughtfully deployed, seen especially in the public spaces. For many hotels, the public spaces (ballrooms, conference rooms) seem like they were afterthoughts, hastily put in after everything else was in place. At the St. Regis San Francisco, every square inch of space is carefully and tastefully planned. We would be terribly remiss if we did not extol the wonderful staff, to whom we are eternally grateful. Every whim was catered to and they made every guest feel comfortable, pampered, and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Experience”
Reviews.Author: peggyplee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the St. Regis in March during a sold out week due to a large conference that I was not attending. I normally cannot stay at a 5 star property like this on business, but since it was the only hotel in the area that was available it made since--it was cheaper than taking cabs to and from my smaller conference at a Market Square hotel. I experienced excellent room service--10 minutes in a sold out hotel vs. 40 min (the Waldorf in NYC last week and it was not even sold out). Great wine bar, and excellent reception when checking. They recognized that I was a SPG Gold member and gave me an upgrade, which was nice since I was paying almost $400 per night. I hope to stay here again. Great location! Great service! Excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “All the extra touches and more”
Reviews.Author: Livie
Reviews.Content: After staying here three nights with my mom for a long weekend break, I don't think I want to stay anywhere else but the St. Regis. In the past month, i have stayed in 3 hotels in this city and this one by far, exceeds my expectations. The entire experience is flawless from the moment they open the doors to you for check-in to the moment they escort you into the taxi to leave. The staff go above and beyond what is required to make sure you are not only comfortable, but pampered. Case in point: I purchased 7 bottles of wine from napa and the concierge was happy to help us pack it really well to make sure it would arrive safely from the flight. The service is attentive but not cloying. The room we stayed in on the 11th floor was beautiful and large. It had all the techno gadgets one would want (auto drapes, light, temperature controls). The styling is modern and luxurious. The bathroom has a large soaker tub. the small touches were all there - ultra soft towels, crisp white linen, silk pillows, deluxe toiletries. The room was fairly quiet for being in such a central location. The food at the hotel was wonderful. We ate at Ame one night and it was spectacular. We also at breakfast at Vitrine and the service there was wonderful. Lastly, the Remede Spa and amenities were to die for. I treated myself to a 60 minute massage and it was one of the best I had ever had. I loved the clean design of the space and having access to the steam room and hot tub were extra touches I enjoyed. Champaign, chocolates and tea are offered in the lounge area. There were a couple of minor glitches here and there (the power went out temporarily; the doors that separate the bathroom and bed area could not actually close) but i can easily overlook these. I love the St. Regis and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Business Class Excellence in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GEERSA
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Hotel certainly lived up to my expectations of it. The staff were very welcoming and competent, and the initial impression carried through my entire stay. The room was spacious, clean, modern and well equipped. Everything needed was provided including DVD player, mini-fridge, fax, printer, complimentary water, etc... In hotel restaurants were pricy but quality was very good. All in all the St Regis is not cheap at all, but one never feels that one is not getting value. Highly recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheAssassin
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in this hotel and I would not stay anywhere else in San Francisco. It is modern and stylish without being over the top. Rooms are large and well laid out, with plasma tvs and an electronic control unit for lights, blind and telephone. Spacious bathrooms with great showers and toiletries. Good service, great bar. The gym and pool are nice but on the small side. Only down-side is that it is expensive - not for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “More than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Roleray
Reviews.Content: Very recently enjoyed a 3-night stay at the St. Reg. Booked an Executive Premiere room - beautiful, well-appointed, LARGE accomodations. I made great use of the hotel amenities, ie lap pool, Remede spa, fitness ctr, - all are top notch. Staff is friendly and professional. Def one of the better hotels in SF. I recommend to any traveler wishing to get away.

Reviews.Title: “extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: allesandra
Reviews.Content: Booked a premium deluxe room and was upgraded to a luxurious suite (I think it was a Metropolitan suite). Decor was extremely modern with some truly bizarre "objets d'arte" and yet it was elegant and inviting.. The bedroom was beautiful and cozy and plush. Automated drapes in the huge living room and br.....good idea to close them during the day because all the glass makes for a very warm suite (and wastes energy if you leave on the a.c.) Our suite was huge and in excellent condition...the bath was luxurious, the bed was extremely comfortable and everything was the best....the linens, towels, comforters, etc. The pool is gorgeous...totally beautiful with magnificent lounging beds...and it was empty every time we used it. The lobby is very chic and would appeal to very sleek, well-dressed younger people especially. The breakfast restaurant was excellent as well. The design of the restaurant (this is their casual restaurant) is lovely. It is one of the few hotel restaurants where the food was actually hot and delicious at breakfast and all but one of the servers was gracious and efficient. The reception staff and the front office managers were quite nice...I am a starwood platinum member and I was treated well. However, I find the attitude of the staff at the St. Regis hotels to be somewhat cold and aloof. I felt the GM at the hotel must have a stingy nature, because certain amenities which one would normally find in this calibre of luxury hotel were not provided. For example, no welcome amenity, no extra soaps, etc in the bath, a paltry amount of towels....a small matter, but curious. Housekeeping was perfect and the room was always immaculate. The spa is gorgeous and expensive. I was not crazy about the location of the hotel. This is not a factor for which the hotel is responsible, obviously . The neighborhood is lively and lots to do nearby but my favorite parts of SF were not readily in reach. The concierge gives excellent suggestions and directions and we had a wonderful time. All in all, an excellent choice with great service and a top quality product.

Reviews.Title: “Big spacious rooms but very loud at night”
Reviews.Author: Cbmw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 4 nights - 3 at the start of our trip to CA and 1 at the end. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious, beds are very comfortable, they have flat screen TVs in the bedroom and a small screen in the bathroom, toiletries are great, there's a hot tub in the spa that's open to all guests and they have a business center with free internet and printing facilities. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Location-wise it's very central to lots of tourist sites in SF and most are within walking distance. We had a room on the 14th floor first time and then on the 7th floor. On both occassions I was woken out of my sleep during the night by noise from either outside or other guests. Construction starts early in SF! There were fire engine sirens going off all night. One of the rooms was an adjoining room and we heard the other guests coming back late one night. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMSP
Reviews.Content: My daughter(8) and I joined my husband on a business trip in San Francisco. This was the most amazing hotel we've ever stayed at...fairly new, state-of-the-art everything. Great rooms - best shower ever, convenient location, inviting pool & spa. Pricey but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hotel & World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: prdomm
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis in San Francisco is to die for! The public spaces are gorgeous; the rooms are goregous and the service is impeccable. I don't think I was ever told "no" during the duration of my trip. The concierge, Robert, was so knowledgeable and made dinner reservations for me and my group. I don't know for sure...but at the restaurant the chef and the manager came and introduced themselves (which I can't help but think the St. Regis had something to do with). I stayed in an Astor Suite which was contemporary in decor and absolutely beautiful. Floor to ceiling glass, leather walls, dark wood floors, two huge plasmas (and a lcd tv in the bathroom) and the softest bed I have ever slept in (complete with Pratesi Linens). I loved the touch-screen console by the bed that allowed you to control the lights, the window shades and thermostat. The St. Regis butler; room service and concierge were just one button away. The bathroom had dual sinks, a soaking tub and a separate shower, befitting a top notch property. The St. Regis blew me away and I recommend doing whatever you can to stay there. I guess the best part of the entire stay is that there was no pretense...just smiles and a helpful attitude that definitely deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “No real substance or value here”
Reviews.Author: travelingmother
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to the St. Regis. We got a reduced price by redeeming some Starwood points, but it was still expensive. Overpriced, to be more exact. We don't mind paying for true luxury, but this hotel doesn't even come close to that. The St. Regis is full of affectations (like the personal butler) but lacking in real amenities or value. We had a corner room on the 13th floor with a nice view of the Metreon and the Marriott (which looks like a better possibility for our next stay). The coolness factor of the touch screen bedside device soon grows tiresome. For example, the drapes can only be manipulated electronically and it is "all or none". Either they are all open or none can be opened. Given the nature of the corner rooms that means that if you want a view of the city, your "neighbors" in the next room automatically get a view of you. The bathrooms are very small and poorly equipped. Hard to believe that a supposed 5-star establishment doesn't even provide a shower cap. (they will draw a $1500 bath for you though, in a tub that is barely big enough for one tall person and scratched up). Our room even had a small hole near the ceiling where the pocket door seals off the toilet and shower from the rest of the bathroom. The only mirror in the room was in the bathroom above the single sink. Again, not our definition of luxury. I had to go into the entry way to do my hair, where there was a mirror and console table. As others have noted, they did contact us by email about our stay. To honor our anniversary they sent up a nice bottle of $7.99 sparkling wine. While it was a nice touch, it is hard to know if we should have been flattered or insulted.:) We did appreciate having the wine bucket though. We walked a block down to Walgreens where we could actually acquire enough ice to chill a bottle, and consumed some very nice sparkling that we purchased outside of the hotel for a Real Person's Price. With no coffee faciilities in the room, or down in the lobby, we were grateful that Peets Coffee is just across the street. For $$$$ a night the hotel could really provide at least a single-serving pod machine in the rooms. It would be way more useful than the tiny stereo system, or even the DVD player. Those are redundant given that most people travel with their IPod and/or buy movies on the TV if so inclined. (or in this case, walk across the street to the Metreon to see a movie). Finally, we came to the city to relax. Hard to do given that except for the bed there was no comfortable place to sit. The desk had two straight-back wooden chairs that were a testimony to form over function. I don't believe I have ever sat in anything more uncomfortable. I do believe that housekeeping does a nice job, and the staff is certainly trained to be friendly. We travel extensively here and abroad, and stay in a wide variety of establishments. The St. Regis would be at the very bottom of our list compared to other places in this price range. You can get a much better value at several other properties in the city. We chose the St. Regis because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor, and it was the only places that had availability. Now we know why the latter was true. SOMA is a great location and we will definitely make it our destination on every city trip. We will however not return to the St. Regis. They have a lot to learn about blending trend with function. I suggest their management visit some of the Starwood Le Meridians that are Art/Tech style such as Vienna. They will come away with a true appreciation of how style can be enhanced by real amenities for the traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: sharon2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights because of the close proximity to Moscone Center, the art museum and great shopping, and of course because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. (How did we ever travel before Trip Advisor?) Loved our time here. We requested and were given a quiet room - on the 17th floor. Everything about the St. Regis is stylish and modern (though not as great as the St. Regis in Manhattan). I loved the TV in the bathroom. Minor annoyances - the tv remote didn't work - probably dead batteries; there was no price list for the overpriced wine in the wet bar - it took 20 minutes to have one sent up; the electronic control center on the nightstand acted up a few times, turning the lights on in the middle of the night; and I find it annoying to be charged extra for the wi-fi use ($15/day). Regarding a couple comments posted earlier about the hallway carpeting, I loved it - a really fun design element. (will post a photo of it) We had the best meal of our stay in the hotel restaurant. The lap pool was warm and beautiful and empty - unfortunately I forgot my suit. Too bad the spa didn't have a basic suit to sell, like they do in some hotels. I would happily stay here again. By the way, San Francisco,what's up with the homeless people on your streets? I've never seen so much panhandling and yelling and screaming and craziness and was actually afraid in some situations.

Reviews.Title: “realy nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandrew
Reviews.Content: The st. Regis was modern and 5 stars. I like the rooms and the pool . Service was the same high standard as at the Ritz Carlton. I like the Ritz better because it was a cooler building. But I think that the St. Regis was nice too, and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Regis doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: himselfetc
Reviews.Content: The third time I've stayed at the Regis, the first with a significant other. She loved the staff, the location and the design. A textbook example of how a hotel should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern and uber cool”
Reviews.Author: seanh007
Reviews.Content: The most sleekly sophisticated hotel I've ever seen, the St. Regis sets a very chic tone with uber-cool colors and designs from the bar to thelobby to the rooms. It's like having your own townhome at the Met or other modern art gallery. For all the formal style to charm the eye there is a great deal of pampering in the perfect beds/linens, inviting bathroom with great bath samples, and the great staff who know how to be formal when necessary but also know when to be warm and friendly. From the personal butler to the restaurant staff to concierge to the folks behind the scenes cooking and cleaning you are made to feel very special. I must complement the cleaning staff who truly outdid themselves to make my room spotless. I could have easily eaten off the bathroom floor. The rooms themselves are fun with cool gadgets that made our stay memorably relaxing. Even my 70+ parents enjoyed the views, the bathtub, and the cool remote controls. Sure you hear some street noise at night even 17 floors up but it is San Francisco (ear plugs for very light sleepers would easily resolve any issues and I'm sure your butler would accomodate). We would defintely stay here again and look forward to other St. Regis hotels on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: traveleveryweek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Dec...last business trip of the year. I travel every week and try to stay at nice hotels, and the St. Regis was no disappointment. It's as clean, nice and upscale as any hotel I've been in. The bar isn't the hippest in the world, but there's a W Hotel a block away if hip is what you're looking for. Overall, the attention to detail, friendliness and helpfullness of the staff, and overall upscale feel of this hotel makes it a true oasis after a long day at work. Take a look at the starwood web site from time to time...they have some great deals...far less than what you might expect to pay.

Reviews.Title: “design overrides comfort”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: If you like modern design hotel and do not mind so much about practical aspects then this is the perfect place. Every person there is very friendly and helpful. There was very little hanging closet space in our suite bedroom. There were no rail to hang the towels to dry after use so they have to be changed after each use. Extreme waste of energy. Many minor things that should not happen in a luxury hotel: e.g. One turn-down they took away the wet towels but did not leave dry ones. Bath soap is too big to fit in the soap dish. One morning they did not clean the breakfast table although I have called them. One morning no newspaper, anothor morning not the one that I have asked. The swimming pool is very nice. Water is pleasantly warm, but there is no dressing room to change swim suit after swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Way cool. Big thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: docjennings
Reviews.Content: You know, when you get what you pay for, this is it!. My husband and I normally dont stay at a more modern hotel, but we were so glad we did. Every gadget you can imagine to make our stay perfecto was a fingertip away. Want the blinds down to make your room pitch black in the middle of the day, just push a button on the side of your bed! Want your butler to run an errand, iron your clothes, or in my case just to come to my room so I can ask his what other people have him do?? (I am not used to butlers). Wow! This place is way cool. Loved every second of it. Bathroom: cool, Bed: comfy, great pillow. Best of all: all the comforts at your fingertips..........literally. How fun!!! Go treat yourself next time you are in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRVLR
Reviews.Content: The room was great and very functional (too many hotels put style over function). The electronic "command center" was very easy and user friendly. What set this hotel apart was the service. We had them recommend restaurants, make reservations, schedule transportation to the airport, and even shine my shoes. Everything was flawless. The location is convenient. The gym is sufficient and the lap pool is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “European hotel in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: ann_and_aron
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough. It had a European feel to it, beautiful big furniture, a cozy little arrangement. I couldn't sleep (it was ridiculously noisey all day and night) until I called downstairs and they were nice enough to give me a fan, so then I was finally able to fall asleep. The hotel is so close to Union Square - so if you want to go shopping this is a good location. It's right across from a Walgreens which I found quite convenient as I always buy my water anywhere but at the hotel. The breakfast is decent, room service just okay, takes quite awhile for it to come up which is fairly normal. I didn't have any problems with the place, but I just wouldn't stay again b/c I wasn't impressed with San Fran. I was surprised at how dirty it was and all of the bums on the street. I've traveled around everywhere but in San Francisco the bums actually yell at people all the time! Not all of them, but it was pretty significant. The other touristy places I visited were just that. Next time, I'll skip it all and just stay in Sonoma:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect high-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: Javarama
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively (investment banker) and was thoroughly impressed with the St Regis in San Fran. Definitely one of the nicest hotels in the country and the service was impeccable. Not sure how anyone could have anything but a great stay there unless that person is impossible to please. But, now that I think about it, my wife had a great stay there too!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LilbearLilbear
Reviews.Content: Suprise birthday weekend for my boyfriend. Upon on arrival we were upgraded to a corner room with amazing views. We felt so comfortable in our beautiful room that we couldn't wait to get back to it at the end of the day and spent quite some time in throughout outr stay. It maybe pricey but if you can appreciate the finer things in life it is definitely worth it! Go ahead and splurge. P.S. If the Bentley is available for the night make sure to take a ride in it on your way to dinner! you can email me qwith questions, I have a few pics that were too large to upload,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: malibuLBK
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the St. Regis, San Francisco last weekend for my birthday and to celebrate our engagement. The hotel sent us an email a few days before our stay asking if there was anything they could do for us and if we were celebrating a special occasion. We told them our situation and arrived at the hotel to find that they had upgraded our room and had left a birthday cake in the room for me. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The service was impeccable and the room was extremely comfortable. We alwayed looked forward to returning to it after our walks around the city. There is a wonderful chaise lounge perched in front of the windows overlooking the city that was so comfortable to sit in and gaze at the view. Also, the bed and Pratesi lines were amazingly comfortable and we enjoyed the rain bath shower as well. We have decided we never want to stay anywhere else when visiting San Fancisco.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - and not just from the street”
Reviews.Author: AlliJ
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be able to say good things about this hotel. It has a great location and the concierge was a life-saver when my baby-sitter had to cancel at the last minute. The staff was much more family friendly that I had feared. My 12th floor room was lovely and comfortable. BUT I agree with the poster who said street noise is to be expected. Yes, there is a fire station near-by and yes there are sirens. Also, while the soundproofing between the rooms is fine, the noise from the hall comes through the doors loud and clear. If you are a light sleeper, stay elsewhere. However, the real problem was management's decision to book the open-air fourth story deck for an extremely loud party that went on until 11:30 at night. The people dancing and whooping to the bad 80s music seemed to be having a great time. I would have liked to have been able to sleep in my fairly expensive bed. Moral of my story - ask about events on the "Yerba Buena Plaza" and make sure you are on the opposite side if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis for 4 nights while attending a convention at the adjacent Moscone Center. The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art is next door. Union Square, Market St. and the Ferry Building/Farmer's Market are within walking distance. The hotel deserves high praise for its location, design, style, technology, amenities and especially its service. The St. Regis and Luxury Collection are the Starwood group's high end chains. Having stayed 3 times at the wonderful St. Regis New York and having visited the St. Regis Monarch Beach CA and Washington DC, I was looking forward to my stay here, and at a convention group rate to boot. The hotel is about 2 years old and located on the corner of Mission and 3rd. Directly on the corner, the facade of a historic 8 story building was preserved and a high rise tower was integrated behind, beside and above it, on what once was a parking lot. The hotel occupies the first 20 floors of the tower; the top 20 or so floors are St. Regis residences. Within the older building are the hotel's 2 restaurants--Ame (dinner) on the first floor and Vitrine (breakfast and lunch) on the 4th--as well as the 2 level spa and offices. There is a landscaped terrace on the roof and another larger terrace on the 4th floor which was tented for an outdoor dinner party when I was there. The lobby in the newer building is compact but stylish and well-designed. A design feature of rose petals is echoed throughout the public areas. Our convention rate was for the superior room category on the lower floors (5-8), so I was pleasantly surprised when I was upgraded to a deluxe room--same size but on a higher floor (15). I also was able to check in early. My room looked similar to the photos posted on 1/1/06 by a TripAdvisor member from Sunnyvale CA. My room faced west with a view of Yerba Buena Gardens, Moscone and points beyond. The east facing rooms face the Bay, but several employees told me the views are often obstructed by the high rise office buildings of the Financial District. The room itself was not too large but contemporary and sleek. The entry foyer had a table, wooden floor sculpture and leather walls. There was another wood wall hanging in the bedroom. The bedside table held the St. Regis signature phone/computer that can control the thermostat, lights, window shades, alarm clock, etc. via a touch screen. There were 2 desk chairs and an easy chair, but no chaise lounge or "fainting chair" as seen on the hotel web site. There was a large marble window ledge--great for counter space. One wall held the 42" flat screen TV (which did not swivel) and 3 recessed doors--one was a too small closet (only about 2 feet of space), another held a safe, fax machine (out of ink) and 3 drawers, the third held the minibar and fridge and DVD/CD player. The spacious bath had an enclosed WC, a tub that opened onto the bedroom, a separate shower stall with marble bench, rain head plus hand-held head. There was a 2nd flat screen TV, but only one sink. In the room and bath, there were not enough places to hang clothes or towels. Technological glitches included: 2 remotes did not work but were quickly repaired (batteries?). With the phone/computer, the party I was speaking to occasionally could not hear me, though I could hear them. The hotel turned this glitch into an example of great service when I requested a wake-up call and the operator called twice but could not hear me, so she sent someone up immediately to give me a personal wake up call at the door. Alas, the phone still was acting up on check out day. Overall service was top notch--quick, courteous and professional--especially the front desk and housekeeping. The problem of a constantly barking dog in the next room was handled well and with many apologies. The doormen were not so attentive--often talking with the valets. No one helped me when I walked up with my luggage when first checking in. Some of the concierge staff, while helpful, were a bit aloof. I believe all the St. Regis' offer Butler Service. In New York this is quite formal, but seems less so here. One Butler I spoke to on the phone was rather unprofessional--when she couldn't answer my question, she yelled/asked another employee without putting me on hold, so I could hear every thing. The public facilities include a medium sized fitness center open 24 hours with the friendliest staff, and a wonderful indoor infinity lap pool, also open 24 hours. The whirlpool, steam room and sauna are within the spa--all are on the small side. The "Business Center" consists of 2 computers and one printer squeezed into a 3rd floor alcove by the elevators. This may be a temporary location. Regarding the sound of sirens mentioned in other reviews--yes you can hear them, but I imagine the other nearby hotels--W, Four Seasons, Westin, Marriott--can as well. I have stayed at a few other high-end hotels here--the Ritz Carlton, Campton Place, the Palace. I would like to one day try the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental, but for now the St. Regis is my favourite San Francisco hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, Modern Luxury at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Mpmark
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis San Fran is a beautiful high-rise property in a great location in one of my favorite cities. The staff was highly-attentive, but never intrusive. The room service was phenommenal and always hot, delicious, and on-time. The beds and high tech window controls were wonderful too. I didn't get a chance to eat at Ame, but I heard wonderful things about the restaurant in the hotel. The bar area was always popular for cocktails and the gym was fantastic. I would highly recommned making reservations at Gary Danko for dinner, one of the best meals I've ever had! Also Boulevard and Postrio were fantastic and R & G Lounge has amazing, authentic chinesse food. I also loved Taylor's Refresher along the Embarcadero for fun and delicious diner style food in an open, casual atmosphere. Overall, the St. Regis is the place to stay if you are looking for one of the best hotels in San Fran with luxury, privacy, and amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “pricey... but worth it. this is a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flatironjake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for five nights during our honeymoon. We booked an executive premier room via Amex and were able to get a free upgrade to an Astor suite (via Amex platinum). The suite was spacious and beautiful. The automated shades are a great touch. Our personal butler was extremely helpful. The concierge did a great job recommending restaurants and helped us set up a wonderful day trip to Sonoma. Vitrine, the restaurant on the third floor serves a nice breakfast, and the lobby bar was a terrific place to have a drink. I was originally reluctant to stay here because of the expensive rates, but you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: oundine
Reviews.Content: Booked through Starwood which was probably a mistake. They were unclear as to the final price of the stay. They only quoted one night's price and stated that that price was for the entire stay. Hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are elegant, well laid out and had plenty of light. All the controls were fully automated and were accessible via a remote by the bed. The bathroom was spacious and the shower featured a rainfall shower head and a seating area in the shower along with a separate bath area. The concierge was helpful along with the front desk. Everyone was very courteous and service was excellent. Only blemish would be the lady who came by to fluff our bed. She ignored our do not disturb light and walked right in. I suppose that getting a bed fluffed might be important to some people but it was rather a nuisance to have someone just barge in. The restaurant below, Ame, is _ok_ but not as good as some reviews would have it. The staff there was also excellent and helpful although our waiter disappeared for long periods of time to talk ot 2 (single?) females eating together. He seemed to enjoy talking to them quite a bit which deterred from the otherwise great service. The elevators are quick and we only had to share it once with one other couple. They are well timed and calibrated so you barely notice the acceleration and deceleration of the elevator. The indoor pool, outdoor lounge area, indoor lounge area and the fitness center are top notch although the indoor pool can be a bit tricky to find. That may have been the reason why it was empty when we went which was a boon for us. Parking is valet only and internet is not free. There is supposedly a business center but we never could find it. But for all this there is a price to be paid. At the original price of $800 / night for our room, it would be very hard to justify staying there. I'm sure you can get cheaper rates than that as the price may have been inflated due to the All Star game. Still very hard to justify when other great hotels are in the general location at 1/3 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Style”
Reviews.Author: NeilMacUK
Reviews.Content: Arrived here to a very good reception, even though we were early, this wasn't mentioned. The butler who met us at our room, showed us all the controls for everything. Mentioned the free bottled water, which they would and did willingly resupply. Loved the fact the swimming pool was open 24 hours so when my partner and i returned after a night out, we just went for a swim. Would recommend it to anyone. Oh and despite having a room facing the park, noise wasnt a problem, but maybe this is because it was a weekend. And lastly Michael who found us taxi whenever we needed one was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: RAZEONE
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the St. Regis from 8/30 â€“ 9/5 and stayed in an executive premiere room on the 18th floor. Check-in went smooth. The views from my corner room were exceptional. Hotel was in a good location. Overall my experience was rather enjoyable and I discuss the room, restaurant and spa in detail below but the Noise level alone might keep me from returning to this hotel in the future. As others have discussed the fire station is located just a few blocks down from the hotel. I am not sure if it has to do with the fact that my room was located on the corner facing the street and that the windows were floor to ceiling but the noise level from the fire engines, police cars and ambulances is unbelievably loud. And the problem is that it is rather frequent and at all hours of the night. All I can say is that I hope they put in better sound proofing for the residences because if I had to listen to these loud noises in my home I would go crazy. Since we got that out of the way I will give you more detailed info about the specifics of the hotel. The Room: The bathroom was of average size with a nice shower and an individual size tub. I found the closest to be a bit small. I was the only using the closest but I imagine that it would be rather cramped for two people. The Plasma was a nice touch but was a bit small given the distance from the bed. The bed was very comfortable. The Maid service was great every time I stepped out I returned to a clean room. The control panel was a nice touch and very easy to use. The black out shades kept the room nice and dark all the way into the morning hours of sunshine. I like the complimentary water bottles they provide every time they clean the room. The internet was a bit pricey ($15/day) but I did like the wireless aspect. The Restaurant: I ate at AME one night and had a great experience. Although it was expensive the service was great and I had some of the best seared albacore I have ever had in my life. The menu is a bit exotic so if you are more conservative you might struggle to find something you enjoy. The Spa: I went to the spa for a 60 minute massage. I found the Menâ€™s locker room to be a bit small and did not like that fact that there was nowhere to sit. You have to leave the locker room and take an elevator down to the waiting area, which is very small and underwhelming. The steam room had an odd smell. The sauna was adequate. The massage was one of the worst I have ever had. I feel that the masseuse did not really listen to my needs and her technique was just odd. I donâ€™t believe it is my responsibility to have to tell the masseuse how to do her job. The bottom line with the spa was that it was expensive and I went there out of convenience but in the future I would probably make the trip to another spa as there are many nice spas in the city and most of them are less expensive. Should mention that a friend of mine (woman) had a massage and enjoyed it so maybe my experience was not the norm. Conclusion: So there was good and bad. I guess the moral of the story is stay here if you donâ€™t care about value and you own some ear plugs then this could be the right choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: cel007
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful hotel we chose to stay in during our trip to San Francisco. The decor is modern but warm with the most beautiful rooms I've had the chance of staying in. I love that it is not frilly and stuffy - just clean and plush. And that bathroom. I never wanted to leave. It is enormous with a panel/door that opens from the tub should you want to soak yet look out into the room. Also a flat screen tv in the bathroom if you prefer privacy. The shower is enormous with a rain-shower head and bench. The doors are frosted glass and an individual 'room' within the bathroom for the toilet which was a nice touch. My favorite experience however was the spa. My massage was truly incredible - also involved deep stretching which was new to me but i loved. The waiting area provided champagne and chocolates, while the rest of the facility boasted a hottub (complete with cucumber slices) sauna and steam room, which i highly recommend taking advantage of. If you book a night here, do yourself a favor and also book something from the spa - it's such a treat. without a doubt i would highly recommend the st. regis.

Reviews.Title: “Style is Born”
Reviews.Author: Star2
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to San Francisco Aug.31-Sept.3 Labor Day weekend was fantastic.The hotel is very understated from the outside, but once inside it is minimalistic , contemporary and very fashionable.Very much my taste.The check in was swift and butler shows you to your room.We booked 1017-1018 adjoining rooms by one master door but still able to close individual doors for privacy.One was a Metropolitan Suite and the other a regular room.Great If you go with kids or my case a Mother-in-law.Very quiet room, never heard any noise or even saw a single person in the hallways for 4 days.However ,like the post before,the sirens(from fire station) are a little much and over the holiday weekend there were alot of alarms.The rooms were clean,stylish and comfortable.A couple of missed items were:no washcloths left each day after room cleaned.Had to call for them.No problem as they were delivered right away.One sink in master bathroom drained really slow( if at all) sometimes. Only one remote worked,batteries changed and still didnt work. Small problems,but for this hotel things should be pitch perfect.We went to go out for dinner one evening and ask the valet to hail a cab for us and he got the house car brought around and had John the driver take us to dinner in the St.Regis Bentley.Awesome ride and an incredible touch of class.The lounge is a great place to have an after dinner drink and sit by the wall with fire .Very comfortable.The young ladies that delivered drinks were well trained in customer service and presentation.Being in a service oriented hometown one can appreciate a city that believes in customer service and treats guests well every where we went.I love the hotel and will stay here always.Also-I fell in love with some features from our room, and upon checkout ask about them.Within 5 minutes a full page of suppliers with names of colors,styles and phone numbers was delivered to me.Its not about how tall you are standing on your wallet,but rather find what type of place makes you happy and this hotel as it all.

Reviews.Title: “Really great service, wonderful food, beware the Firestation Noise!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Well, this was a disappointment. Booked the St. Regis, on 3rd Street and Mission in San Francisco for a night away from the kids for our anniversary. What went well: -Great service -Wonderful location -Ame, the restaurant, has surprising and delicious food in a quiet enough room that adults can talk! -Style, style, style in the public rooms, in the room decoration, in the bathroom design... -Neat views overlooking the Yerba Buena complex -Enthralling use of gratuitous touch screen technology to control the drapes, shades, lights, wakeup and phone -Good damping of REGULAR traffic noise from 3rd Street -Stylish, beautiful people drifting through the lobby; makes it exciting to check-in and sit for a drink. -Heard little or nothing from any of the rooms around us or from the hallway during our stay. What was puzzling and not so good: -The San Francisco Fire Department's Station 1 is located around the corner at 676 Howard St./3rd St. Would you like to guess how many times they went out on Friday night? 6! Would you like to guess how clearly you can hear the sirens of the pumper and the ladder truck? Ah, very, very clearly indeed, even from a high, high room...I think the acoustician on this hotel job must have underestimated the impact of that station. Whoa. If I had an important meeting the next meeting and didn't have any ear plugs...Not so good. BTW, I would be cautious of book the W hotel on the corner of 3rd and Howard for the same reason; it might be even LOUDER because it's even closer. Hope this helps someone pick a quieter property....

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: bostonguy505
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge with high ceilings and top contemporary furnishings. Overall the rooms and the hotel is comfortable, spacious and a destination you won't want to leave. I preferred it to the four seasons but both are exceptional

Reviews.Title: “great location not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gascony
Reviews.Content: stayed at the st regis for 4 nights in early august. stayed in a suite (astor) which was pretty small even by US hotel standards and really wasn't anything special - i was on the 15th floor and so no view either. hotel bar was actually really great - good atmosphere and the bar staff were great. the spa was fabulous - great treatments and really cool setting. only had room service (breakfast) but it was efficient if not the best food. the concierge (always something i focus on!) desk was pretty useless - couldn't get tickets for a show that wasn't exactly the hotest ticket in town; booked a restaurant for us that was a really dull local italian with nothing special about it - could have been anywhere in the world and the food was average (i asked for somewhere not too fancy but not too casual that had great food and was typically californian......the place they booked was nothing like this AND when we arrived they didn't actually have our reservation!). directions to places were given reluctantly and there was always a queue. they suggested i take a taxi to the hairdressers which was a 3 minute walk away....! overall, ok hotel, nothing special and wouldn't go back

Reviews.Title: “Rotten, Wretched, Regis”
Reviews.Author: Perigrinator
Reviews.Content: This is an updated review - I wrote a review of the St. Regis in March 2007 and gave the hotel high marks - I returned this time because of the positive experience the first time. Unfortunately, this rating, I give the hotel a -10 rating on a scale of 1-10. This experience was just the opposite of my first stay. The first stay, the service was impeccable; this stay, the service was haughty and pompous; the room was dirty; and nothing in the room worked; the digital clocks had the wrong time and date (guests can't change the clock time or date and thus, I had to call engineering); the TV was inoperable - yet another call to engineering!; the internet was not working - yes, yet another call to engineering. After four calls to the front desk to have engineering come to my room - the front desk was less than cooperative. After my stay, I sent and email to the executive assistant of the General Manager and they never responded. Long and short, an horrible stay. After the stay, Starwood hotels and St. Regis sent me a customer survey - I filled it out indicating the above. The GM of the St. Regis THEN saw fit to contact me and basically scolded me for filling out the critique! and not "giving them a chance" to get back to me. In any event, the GM did not make it right. Starwood did a follow up survey and contacted me again and I reiterated the above - they were apologetic and explainded that the hotel had undergone a management change but there was no excuse for the poor behavior or poor service. Having said that, while I may stay at other Starwood properties, I will not go back to the St Regis in SF unless current mgmt. changes...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property, Fantastic Food, Needs a little Warmth”
Reviews.Author: ByronDreams
Reviews.Content: Stayed for weekend getaway. Courteous, helpful front desk staff. They all seemed young and a bit unsure of themselves, but they definitely wanted to be helpful which goes a long way. We mentioned that it was a special occasion and they upgraded the room to a suite and left a small and quite delicious cake in our room. The room itself was very nice, but didn't feel as posh as I expected considering the hype. The beds are exceptional and the bathroom was really lovely, but the rest of the room and furnishings felt quite cold. The design in both the rooms and lobby is so restrained that it has no discernable style other than "modern". It comes across as cold. That's okay for a garden variety Westin, but if the St. Regis is supposed to be the Lexus of the Starwood properties, I think they need to bring it up a notch. A few small splashes of color, a plant, or flowers would go a long way to making these rooms special and giving them some warmth. The lobby and lobby bar also have a cold vibe. The food was fantastic across the board -- in room, at the bar and at the restaurant, Ame. Room service breakfast was prompt and absolutely delicious. Appetizers and drinks at the bar were creative and tasty. Dinner at Ame was delicious and unusual and the staff was extremely knowledgeable and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but oddly pedestrian”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 19th Floor in a Grand Deluxe room which was very comfortable with a good view and a spacious and luxurious bathroom. However, the set up for in room dining is odd for two people;one person sits on the bed the other on the mini chaise. There is no tea or coffee making faciliites in the room ,which I admit is a pet hate of mine however this is exacerbated when it then takes twenty to 30 minutes for a pot of tea to arrive which costs $25, plus the tip for the waiter. So for all the sales pitch about St Regis service, guests at this hotel are always being lead into ways with require interaction with the staff . This may suit some people, however, it is not good if you happen to prefer some privacy and seclusion at the end of the day. Finally, for all the design hype about this hotel ( Wallpaper guide etc) , the public spaces are strangely prosaic. They lack originality and depth; it all feels a bit cramped, transient and superficial. I absolutely do not understand the excitement about this hotel. It is comfortable but far from excellent. I can recommend it only as another fairly standard five standard.

Reviews.Title: “This is how it's done!”
Reviews.Author: 212Girl
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco often for work; the St. Regis is the nicest and coolest one I have stayed at yet! The decor is modern, but not over the top modern, just contemporary. Beautifully appointed entry and very welcoming staff. They walked me up to my room to explain the new technology - which is highlighted by a digital device that controls everything from room service to lighting to the do not disturb sign, all with bedside convenience. The beds are fluffy and obviously extremely clean. The place was spotless. Bathroom necessities smell amazing, was tempted to swipe them! The gym is great, not huge but certainly new and good equipment. There is also a huge pool, if you are a swimmer be sure to visit. I did not use the spa during my stay but the menu looked extensive. There is a Japanese restaurant inside the hotel that had amazing sushi. The price is pretty high, but well worth it in today's market, especially for business travelers. My only complaint is that my friend parked there for 2 1/2 hours and it cost her $36. I'm from NYC and I think that is pretty insane. Overall, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “New luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkseattle
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, new hotel with a luxurious and modern style in the financial district. Food was excellent and service was strong overall, although I have a couple of knits which prevented me from giving them a "5". They lost my dry cleaning and returned it a day late, although they were immensley apologetic and didnt charge me. They also had a great feature in the room, a printer with a nice long USB cord - I was thrilled since I could print out my boarding pass right in my room and head off to the airport - whoops, the ink on the print cartridge was running low - no luck. The thought behind the printer was great - execution left a bit to be desired. Nevertheless - a nice stay. I'd definitely give them another shot.

Reviews.Title: “Stay off the 7th floor if you do not smoke”
Reviews.Author: rhodepop
Reviews.Content: Our experience was not so hot. Stayed Sat-Thurs but my wife went to the hotel Spa on Friday so I confirmed, in person, our non-smoking room a day before checkout. When checking in on Saturday, I confirmed with the staff that our room was non-smoking. Around 1:30 am we were awakened by the smell of cigarette smoke and a VERY loud party down the hall. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. It happened again around 3. This time, I was told that our floor was a smoking floor and that we could move to another floor (at 3 am). I'm sorry but this is not the Red Roof Inn. The information given to me was wrong 3 times. Unacceptable. We moved floors the next day and the rest of the stay was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Visually divine, but...”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at the St. Regis because we'd heard so much about the "legendary" service. Because of my job I don't often have time to do any research for restaurants to go to when travelling. I rely a lot of the time on the advice from the concierge where I'm staying. In the past I've never had an issue. But the concierge staff at the St. Regis needs a major overhaul. It was some of the worst service I've ever had. And that it was in a St. Regis is very surprising. The room was nice and clean. The rain shower was divine. The LCD screen by the bedside didn't always work. When selecting certain lights to go off, they wouldn't work - so we had to unplug lamps. Too bad the windows don't open and the AC blower isn't so strong. For the full story - keep reading. Otherwise, that's about it. FULL STORY: When we checked in, I asked the concierge for a restaurant where we could get Halibut. And maybe something with pasta. He sent us to a place called Rose Pistola in North Beach. When we got our menus we noticed there was no Halibut on it. That was irritating. We asked for a restaurant with Halibut and he sent us to a place WITHOUT it. Very strange. The only other item on the menu that looked decent was the Risotto. They were out of it. By that point it was nearly 9 PM - our choices were to eat there or go back and order over-priced room service. We asked our waitress if the chef would make us "Aglio e Olio" (an italian staple). He did, but it wasn't very good. In fact, we didn't see any garlic in it at all. The atmosphere in the restaurant was similar to an Applebees and the food wasn't much better. It was not authentic Italian. When we got back to the hotel I called to speak with the Concierge to inform him that he'd really let us down. He'd left for the day so I told the person who answered the phone. The man said the concierge would call us at 8:30 AM so I could tell him what kind of lousy dinner we had. No call from the concierge the next morning. The least he could've done was apologize. So I called him. That day (Monday) there was a new concierge working. I asked him to find us a place for lunch that served Caprese (that typical italian buffalo mozzarella and tomato salad). He gave us his favorite place, Scala's - and another one down the street. On our way to lunch we walked to a chocolatier given to us by Concierge Number 1 when we asked for a place to buy truffles. We said we wanted the best truffles - but NOT Joseph Schmidtt truffles. Well... We arrived at the address and noticed it was a candy store. They had chocolate items, yes, but none of them were truffles. Not a single one. We then walked all the way to the restaurant for lunch and noticed there was no Caprese on their menu. At this point it was like a running joke. Now Concierge Number 2 had failed. After running a Wild Goose Chase due to unaware and incompetant concierges we decided to just go back and look up Fodor's and Conde Nast online. Though Concierge Number 2 had booked us a place for dinner that evening, I didn't want to risk it. Doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results is insanity! It was our last night in the city and we were determined to find a good restaurant in San Francisco. Within 10 minutes online we'd found the best rated place in the city that was open on a Monday night (Jardiniere) and booked a table. Back in our room, Jeremy the Front Desk Manager sent his apologies and some wine and cheese. It was a very thoughtful note. Simply the mere mention was nice. Neither of the Concierges apologized. I got the feeling they don't like to admit fault. The trouble is = the database used by the concierge staff is not good. They need to compare that to Fodors and Zagats. Rose Pistola got 2 stars (out of five). That would've been nice to know. Had I known that, we'd have never gone there. Halibut or not. The other problem is they think about their personal tastes... Never once considering the tastes of their clients. They also need to ask better questions. Simply typing in the word "chocolate" into their database isn't going to bring up the best truffles in the city. Obviously it's my fault I relied on the concierges. But as a filmmaker, I don't often have time and in the past it's always been a great experience to rely on concierge wisdom. I shall think twice about returning to a St. Regis. For the price, one would think they'd have their act together by now.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guest12OrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights at the end of April. I love the room, the service, and the location! We got a standard room on the 10th floor, so the noise that others mentioned did not bother us. The room was spacious and very comfortable, especially the bathroom; although I wish that thereâ€™s double sink instead of one. The control panel quit working one morning but they sent someone to fix it quickly after we reported it. The pool is nice but there's no one there during our entire stay. The pool water might be a bit cold. The exercise room is big and again, no one was using it. I wanted to use the steam room and Jacuzzi on Sunday morning (around 9:30 am) but there was a man in the women dressing room asking me to come back in 10 min because he needed to fix something; I found it awkward since they should have kept the door locked when doing maintenance. The concierge was excellent. We were on the road and called the concierge for dinning reservation. Very knowledgeable staff! Overall this hotel is very luxurious, modern, and extremely clean. We love to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, can use a few touch ups here and there.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: My three night stay at the St. Regis San Francisco property was excellent. But there are some areas that can need improvements. But first lets get to the positives. full disclosure: we got upgraded from deluxe corner room to metropolitian suite due to SPG Platinum status. Postives: the suites are very large with two flat screen tv and 1 small tv in the bathroom. the bathroom amentities are probably the best I've seen among the luxury hotel chains. everything in the room is controlled by electronic key pad (windows, lights, alarm, do not distrub sign, etc). The property is new so you will have updated modern decor and new furniture. The bathrooms are huge! Almost 1/3 the size of the room itself. Everything was clean and housekeeping came twice a day. it seems like they know when we're leaving and when we're in the room. Turndown service always included bottle water. There was not a morning when they forgot to bring my Wall Street Journal and my requested US Today (you'll be surprised how often hotels forget or don't care). Towels are soft and constantly refreshed and well stocked. Wireless internet in the room! The doorman, bellman, and parking attendants are very nice and knowledgable. This property is walking distance from the shops at Union Square and the SF Moma (but very far from Fisherman Wharf, the piers, Golden Gate Bridge). The decor is very modern, clean, and intricate. They definitely spent alot building and decoring the entire hotel. The pool is open 24 hrs (no lifeguard). The pool is very clean and nice. It is also ideal for swimming laps. The valet service was FAST and front desk always personally called for our morning "wake up call" (not a machine). Cons: No ice machine. Unfortunately you have to call to have ice delivered to the rooms. Sometimes its just easier to walk down the hall to get it youself. The shower did not have a curtain or door, so you end up splashing water everywhere. My wife complained that it took her forever to wash her hair b/c of the "rain showers". Since the showers did not have doors or curtains, the whole bathroom fogs up, preventing you from using the mirrors afterwards. Most upscale luxury hotels have doors where the toilets are, this one did not. May be inconvient when you're sharing the bathroom with someone else or would prefer more privacy. I like the open feel but not in this area! Internet still cost additional $15 when you are already paying $800+ per night (whereas internet at low end properties like Hilton Garden Inns are usually free).. a bit backwards. Overnight parking for guests is $51. This is the highest I've ever paid for overnight parking at a hotel. The butler service that comes complimentary wwith the room is a bit annoying. She went through the entire routine of showing us where every single thing is down to the light switch and how to plug in your ipod in the dvd player. Wasted about 15min of our time when we arrive in our room. The hotel needs to realize when guests arrive to their rooms, they just want to relax and not be bothered. Breakfast was insanely expensive ($5 for OJ and $16 for Pancakes... before tax, tip, and service charge). I'm sorry... but no plain pancakes are worth $16. The house car (Bentley) was always out or busy, so we did not get to use it at all despite asking every single day for 3 nights. One night we lucked out and it was available but the driver said they are restricted to a 2 mile radius around the hotel (so its pretty much useless in my opinion). Not sure if that was true or if he just didnt want to do his job. The rooms did not have and ironing board, iron, or coffee machine (maybe ppl that pay $800+ a night do not iron their own clothes or make their own coffee?). Tips: get a room a few floors above 8th floor. We can hear the cars at night below (sirens, police cars, car engines, etc). Walk down the block for Starbucks or Peets Coffee for morning fix.
